L_Ragazzi of L_distinction : .
IN L_December , 1943 , the L_men L_working M_feverishly to L_create the L_first L_American L_atomic L_bomb L_sent a M_team of ‘ M_spooks ’ to L_Naples .
One of their L_main L_assignments was to L_contact L_Edoardo L_Amaldi , a L_physicist L_thought to be in L_hiding near L_Rome .
Six L_months L_later , the L_day before L_Rome 's L_liberation by the L_Allies , L_Amaldi was L_found .
He was L_interviewed by L_Moe L_Berg , then one of the most L_famous L_baseball L_players in L_America .
L_Berg was L_also an L_agent of the L_Office of L_Strategic L_Services , which was L_later to M_give M_birth to the L_CIA .
His L_job was to L_convince L_Amaldi to M_pack his M_bags because there was a L_ship M_waiting at L_Naples to M_take him to the L_United L_States .
L_Amaldi 's L_presence there had been L_sought by two other L_Italian L_colleagues , L_also L_physicists .
His L_mentor , L_Enrico L_Fermi , L_later to be L_called ‘ the M_father of the L_bomb ’ , and L_Emilio L_Segre ( who L_died in L_California L_earlier this L_year ) .

L_Amaldi M_dodged the L_American L_invitation , L_perhaps because ( with L_Rome L_liberated ) L_Fermi 's M_mantle in L_physics had M_fallen on his M_young M_shoulders and there were M_younger L_minds to M_teach .
He M_wore that M_mantle L_well at L_Rome L_University until his L_retirement in 1978 .
But L_Amaldi L_never L_really M_retired nor L_grew L_old .
He M_kept M_regular L_hours in the L_university 's L_physics L_building , L_spoke at L_scientific L_meetings this L_year in L_Moscow and L_Washington .
As L_President of the L_Accademia L_Nazionale dei L_Lincei he had M_delivered the L_welcoming L_address on L_Tuesday to a L_symposium of L_scientists .
He then L_ordered a L_car to M_call for him the M_next L_morning for a L_similar L_occasion and was M_felled by a M_stroke while L_waiting for the L_lift .
L_Amaldi L_grew up in a L_small L_town in L_Lombardy , and M_took his L_doctorate in L_physics from L_Rome at the L_remarkably L_early L_age of 21 .

In 1929 , he L_became one of the ragazzi di L_Via L_Panisperna — the L_street where L_Fermi 's ‘ L_kids ’ L_carried out their own L_experiments under the M_master in their own L_under-financed L_lab .
L_Emilio L_Segre was one L_kid , and L_Bruno L_Pontecorvo , L_later to L_defect from L_Britain to the L_Soviet L_Union , another .
It is L_interesting to M_note that the ‘ M_pope ’ — as the L_kids L_called Fermi — ‘ because he 's L_always L_right ’ , was only seven L_years L_older than L_Amaldi .
L_Amaldi M_astounded his M_group in L_October 1934 with his L_discovery that by L_slowing down , L_rather than L_accelerating , L_neutrons , he could M_provoke L_intense L_nuclear L_reactions .
He M_held a L_chair in L_physics from 1937 until his L_retirement L_publishing more than 150 L_papers on L_atomic and L_nuclear L_physics .
He was M_awarded L_honorary L_degrees by L_Algiers , L_Glasgow and L_Oxford .
He L_became a L_founder , and L_active L_executive , of the L_European L_Centre for L_Nuclear L_Research in L_Geneva .
I had the L_pleasure of two M_long L_talks L_last L_year with L_Professor L_Amaldi about his L_knowledge of what the L_German L_physicists were doing with their L_atoms during the L_war L_years .
M_Apart for his L_incongruously L_white L_hair , L_Amaldi L_seemed to have the L_mental L_lucidity and L_expected L_energy of a L_man half his L_age .
His L_modesty , L_considering his L_world-wide L_fame in his M_field , was L_endearing .
I L_knew L_almost L_nothing about L_physics but we M_shared some L_jokes about the L_Rome L_telephone L_system .

In 1949 , L_Amaldi L_wrote to the L_Italian L_prime L_minister M_asking for L_permission to L_produce and L_sell L_sealing L_wax for L_letters , ‘ so that we may M_raise L_needed L_funds for our L_physics L_lab ’ .
The L_reply M_came from an L_under-secretary who M_said that the M_present L_funding was L_considered L_adequate and the L_commercial L_undertaking would be L_ill-advised .
It was L_signed by L_Giulio L_Andreotti , the M_present L_prime L_minister .
L_George L_Armstrong L_Edoardo L_Amaldi , L_born L_Carpaneto L_Piacentino L_September 5 , 1908 ; L_died L_Rome , L_December 5 , 1989 .
Midwife at the M_birth of a L_state .
THE L_INTIFADA is a L_people 's M_unarmed M_revolution against L_occupation .
Its two L_main L_slogans , L_repeated L_countless L_times in the L_directives M_issued by the M_underground L_leadership , are M_freedom and L_independence .
It has M_employed a L_dual M_strategy to L_achieve these two M_objectives .

L_First , a L_comprehensive L_civil L_disobedience M_campaign was L_begun by which L_people M_severed , or M_minimised , all the M_contact M_points by which they were M_bound to the L_Israeli L_occupation L_authority .
This M_campaign L_included L_resignations of L_Palestinian L_officials from L_public L_posts , the L_boycott of L_Israeli L_goods and L_products , and the L_refusal to L_pay L_taxes and L_fines .
L_Partial and M_full M_strikes , L_demonstrations , L_sit-ins , L_conventions … all these have in L_fact only L_constituted the outer M_layer of an M_inner M_mechanism of L_civilian L_rebellion .
The L_second , and L_complementary , M_part of the L_Intifada L_strategy M_concentrated on the M_construction of an L_indigenous L_national L_authority .
As L_Israel 's L_authority was being M_lifted , the L_population L_began L_creating an L_alternative L_authority of their own .
L_Popular L_committees were L_established in L_villages , L_refugee L_camps , L_suburbs , L_streets , in L_fact in every L_community .

Some M_headway was M_made in M_expanding L_self-sufficiency , whether through L_utilising more L_land for L_agriculture , L_developing M_home L_economies , or M_encouraging L_local L_manufacturers and L_products .

L_Villages and L_refugee L_camps were L_thus being L_developed into ‘ M_liberated ’ or ‘ L_independent ’ L_areas , if not L_militarily , then at L_least L_psychologically , L_politically and L_infrastructurally .

L_Bloody M_clashes would L_occur whenever L_armoured L_units L_raided these L_villages , L_storming through L_makeshift L_defensive L_road L_blocks and M_responding to L_rocks being L_thrown with M_live L_bullets and L_tear L_gas ; but no L_sooner would these L_army L_units be M_gone than L_authority would L_revert to the L_village L_residents .

L_Palestinian L_flags would be L_raised on L_minarets and L_church L_spires , L_road L_blocks would again be L_erected , and L_life in all its M_aspects would once again be M_run by the L_local L_leadership .

The M_structure of the L_developing L_national L_authority has been both M_diffuse L_enough to L_prevent it from being M_destroyed by any one L_single M_sweep of L_arrests ( there have been more than 50,000 L_arrests since the L_Intifada 's L_outbreak ) , and L_coherent L_enough to M_allow for the L_existence of a L_unified M_resistance L_strategy .

While the L_entire M_network of L_popular L_committees , L_local L_institutions and the L_general L_public L_constitute the M_field M_commanders in the M_battle of L_civilian L_disobedience and of M_constructing a L_political L_infrastructure , a M_rotating L_Unified L_National L_Command M_acts in the M_role of L_field-general , L_issuing a L_bi-monthly L_directive M_outlining L_policy and L_determining L_specific M_resistance L_programmes .

A M_high M_level of M_mobility in the M_structure M_allows for M_continuous M_interchange of M_roles and L_ideas , and M_retains for the L_Unified L_National L_Command the M_closeness to M_grass M_roots that is L_required to M_make it L_truly M_reflect L_people 's L_wishes and L_sentiments .

THIS M_expanded M_network of L_popular L_committees and L_institutions M_making up the L_Unified L_leadership is M_infused by L_tens of L_thousands of L_activists who M_belong to , or M_identify with , the L_different L_factions of the L_PLO .
In L_effect , L_therefore , the L_PLO M_exists at all M_levels of L_organisation within the L_occupied L_territories .
L_Thus the L_Palestinian L_national M_movement both L_inside and outside the L_occupied L_territories is an M_organic L_whole .
The M_pattern of the L_Intifada has been L_cyclical .
M_Thrusts of M_resistance ( L_mass L_demonstrations , L_resignations , L_tax L_rebellions , L_etc ) would M_come in M_crests .
The M_pattern is L_determined by a M_wide L_variety of L_factors , L_including what the L_Israeli L_army does .
But the M_relation is L_complex , not M_uni-directional .

M_Harsh M_measures — M_putting an L_entire L_community under an L_absolute L_curfew for a M_continuous L_lengthy L_period of L_time , L_demolishing L_homes , L_uprooting L_olive or L_citrus L_trees , L_physical L_intimidation and L_terror L_tactics M_employed by L_raiding L_army L_units , L_shooting , L_killing , M_cutting off L_water or L_electricity L_supplies and L_telephone M_links to L_villages or L_towns , L_mass L_arrests , L_intimidatory L_interrogation L_techniques — can L_either L_create a L_temporary L_lull or M_activate an M_eruption .
The L_army L_never M_knows which it will be .
It is as if it is M_walking through a M_minefield .
The M_wave-like M_pattern of the L_Intifada , its M_pains and M_sufferings , are all L_reminiscent of the M_process of M_birth .
The L_metaphor is L_apt , as L_Palestinians M_regard themselves as L_engaging in a L_process of M_giving M_birth to their L_independent L_Palestinian L_state .
Through their M_revolution , the M_masses are both M_mother and M_midwife to the M_birth of this L_state .
The L_Intifada is the M_midwife of M_freedom .
Through it , L_Palestinians are M_struggling on a L_daily L_basis to M_shake off L_Israel 's L_authority and to M_construct their own .

The M_struggle M_reflects a M_revolution in L_mass M_consciousness , by which L_people have M_come to L_realise that L_ideas and L_aspirations must be L_embodied in L_manifest L_acts if L_reality is to be M_changed .
L_Thus , wherever one M_looks , one M_finds L_people L_engaged in the M_construction of the M_blocks that will M_make up the L_Palestinian L_state .
It is a M_conscious L_effort .
The M_masses are being L_engaged in the M_craft of M_state-masonry .
In this L_process of L_state M_building , L_many M_stages have been M_covered .
The L_Declaration of L_Independence M_issued by the L_Palestine L_National L_Council ( L_PNC ) on L_November 15 L_last L_year L_constitutes a L_major M_landmark along this M_road .

Its L_significance M_lies in its M_double M_message : that the M_aim of the L_Palestinian M_struggle is the L_establishment of L_Palestinian L_independence , and that this L_independence is M_regarded as being not at L_Israel 's M_expense .

This has been a L_constant L_theme of L_Intifada L_policy : that we L_wish to M_build ( L_Palestine ) , not to M_destroy ( L_Israel ) ; that we L_wish to L_achieve M_freedom ( for our L_people ) , not to L_deprive L_others ( L_Israelis ) of it ; that we L_wish to L_protect and L_save L_lives ( ours ) , not to L_endanger the L_lives of L_others ( L_Israelis ) .

In one of L_several L_Intifada L_leaflets L_written in L_Hebrew and M_addressed to the L_Israeli L_soldiers on L_duty in the L_occupied L_territories , the M_message was L_repeated : L_Soldier , L_go L_home .
L_Return to your L_family and L_children .
Be with them in L_peace so that we may L_remain with our L_family and L_children in L_peace .
We do not L_wish to M_harm you , or your L_state .
We L_wish to be M_unharmed , in our own L_state .
How can the L_process of L_state M_building be L_developed ?

If the L_PNC L_Declaration of L_Independence L_constituted a L_major M_landmark in this L_process , the L_time has M_come to M_embark on another L_major M_step , that of M_declaring the M_setting up of a L_state or L_government M_structure .
AN L_ESCALATION of the L_Intifada in this M_direction would M_serve two L_purposes at once .
L_First , it would M_consolidate the M_structures of the M_developing L_national L_authority which is M_competing to M_replace the L_occupation L_authority .
L_Second , it would M_consolidate the M_image and M_essence of the L_Intifada as a L_constructive , not a L_destructive , M_force .
L_Naturally , to M_embark on such a M_step is not L_necessarily to L_succeed M_immediately in L_realising it .
L_Rather , it is a M_challenge .
It will be a further M_challenge to L_Israel 's L_occupation , M_conceived in the M_image of L_earlier M_challenges of the L_Intifada .
But it will L_also be a M_challenge to us , L_Palestinians , M_summoning us to L_work more L_energetically towards the L_idea 's L_fulfilment .
It would be a M_natural M_extension of the L_Intifada 's L_dual M_strategy towards M_disengagement from L_Israel , and the L_corresponding L_process of L_state M_building .
It would further M_naturalise and L_legitimise the M_evolving M_skeletal M_form of L_Palestinian L_independence .
It would L_provide the L_multitudinous L_popular L_committees and L_activities with a more L_advanced M_form of L_organisation and M_structure .
It would L_enable L_better L_planning and L_performance .

It would M_maximise L_civilian M_tactics of M_resistance and M_defuse the M_natural L_potential for L_violence , M_containing and L_eventually L_eliminating the M_marginal but L_intrusive L_phenomenon of L_collaborator L_activation by L_Israeli L_security L_authorities and L_collaborator L_execution by L_local L_Palestinians .
It would L_create a further L_fact that would M_put L_Israel on the M_spot .
L_Israel 's M_reaction , L_however M_hostile , could only further our L_cause .

L_Arresting or L_deporting the L_tens of L_thousands of L_Palestinian L_professionals who would be L_employed in L_perfectly L_apolitical , M_harmless and L_humanitarian L_jobs can only further M_isolate the L_Israeli L_Government .
M_Half-way M_measures can only M_imply M_half-way L_success .
A modus vivendi would L_also M_imply L_success .
In L_general , our L_policy should be to M_proceed with M_building our L_state M_block by M_block , without L_waiting to be M_given a M_gift of it through L_negotiations .
We should M_regard L_negotiations L_rather as the M_means by which we could L_establish M_formal L_agreements between our L_state and L_Israel .
Such L_agreements can M_range from the L_issue of M_borders to the L_issue of M_free L_wave-lengths for our L_future L_television and L_radio L_networks .

In the L_meantime , we have the M_capacity to M_bring L_coherence and L_organisation to a M_whole M_range of L_activities , further L_consolidating the L_institutional M_linkage between the L_people in the L_occupied L_state and the L_PLO L_leadership .
L_Entire L_departments can be M_set up , in L_health , L_foreign L_affairs , L_agriculture , L_trade , L_finance , L_education , L_justice , L_religion , L_information and L_social L_welfare .

A M_pyramid L_administrative M_structure , L_establishing M_links from L_popular L_committees in L_villages L_right up to the L_Executive L_Committee of the L_PLO ( in its M_capacity as a L_Cabinet ) , can be L_established .
During the L_Intifada the L_people have been M_engaged in M_building the M_side M_walls .
A L_government would L_provide the M_roof which would M_bring these M_walls M_together .
It would M_add another L_necessary M_touch in the L_process of L_creating a L_Palestinian M_home .
L_Sari L_Nusseibeh , a M_leading L_Palestinian L_intellectual , is L_professor of L_philosophy at L_Bir L_Zeit , the L_West L_Bank L_university M_closed by the L_Israelis L_early L_last L_year .
His L_ideas are L_widely L_influential among L_Palestinians .
L_Nusseibeh …
‘ The L_Palestinian L_national M_movement inside and outside the L_occupied L_territories is an M_organic L_whole ’ L_PHOTOGRAPH : L_DAVID L_SILLITOE

The L_boy and the L_dog L_skirted L_round L_opposite L_sides of the L_puddle , the L_boy , a L_light , L_tall L_fourteen-year-old , M_labouring in L_wellington L_boots too L_large for him , and the L_dog , a L_three-year-old L_Labrador L_bitch , M_picking her L_way L_reluctantly , with L_frequent L_pauses , as if her L_paws L_hurt .

The L_boy , unlike the L_dog , L_knew that the L_mud did not M_go on for L_ever ; beyond the L_bridge , the L_disused L_railway L_embankment along which they were L_walking L_became L_built up , so that L_water M_ran off it .

He L_pulled the L_dog L_close to him to L_let a L_mixed M_string of L_horses and L_Ponies L_go L_past , L_waving L_shyly to the L_lead L_rider , a L_pretty , L_capable L_girl an L_unbridgeable two L_years L_older than him .
He L_watched her as she L_went L_past at a L_walk , the L_black L_Labrador and he both L_gazing L_wistfully , their L_breath L_steaming in the L_cold L_February L_morning .
He L_waited till the L_horses were L_well L_away and L_looked L_round the L_wide , L_flat L_landscape L_carefully before L_unclipping the L_lead .

‘ L_Way you L_go , L_Patty , ’ he L_said M_softly , and the L_dog was off , M_hurling herself along the L_embankment , all L_paws and M_flying L_ears , after a L_rabbit who had been M_sitting in a M_patch of L_sun but L_disappeared with M_contemptuous L_ease as she L_came L_close .

The L_boy had been L_told L_unequivocally not to L_let her off the L_lead — the L_riding-school only M_used the L_land by M_grace of its L_owner and it was a L_shooting M_estate — but he L_hated L_keeping the L_dog L_straining at the L_lead and L_knew that she would L_always L_come to his L_call .
He L_stood for a L_moment L_laughing at her as she M_cast M_furiously for the L_vanished L_rabbit , and L_walked on , to M_catch her up , along the L_raised L_embankment .

The L_trees had M_grown up beside it in the twenty-five L_years since the L_railway had M_closed , and the L_boy L_stopped every now and then to L_watch L_small L_birds L_hopping around the L_top L_branches .
He L_particularly L_liked this M_stretch ; L_nothing but the M_odd L_tractor and the L_horses L_ever L_came down this L_embankment , and the L_birds were L_unworried by his L_presence .

After half a L_mile he L_decided to L_turn off the L_embankment and L_walk up the L_side of the L_next L_field and along the L_path at the L_top of it , L_following the L_horses whom he could L_still L_see in the L_distance .
He L_called L_Patty to him .
She did n't L_come , which was L_surprising ; she was a L_docile L_creature and L_particularly L_devoted to him because he L_always L_took her for a L_walk when he was at the L_stables .
He could L_hear her L_barking and L_looked down over the L_steep L_side of the L_embankment to the L_bottom of the L_trees .
He L_called her again and again , but she would not L_stop L_barking at L_something he could not L_see .
L_Probably a L_squirrel , he L_decided , and M_slithered down the L_side of the L_embankment to M_join her , L_scolding as he L_went .
L_Straightening up beside the L_dog , he L_looked where she was L_looking , and L_blinked .
He L_saw a L_leg , L_uncomfortably L_wedged between L_sapling L_trees , L_swollen L_grotesquely , and M_gazed at it , L_stupidly , L_wondering if it was L_plastic .

As his L_eyes L_focused he L_realized he was L_looking at a L_hideously L_swollen L_human L_body , and just then , as the M_light L_breeze M_shifted , he M_caught the M_stomach-turning L_odour of L_decay .

He was a L_sensible and L_capable L_boy , an L_eldest L_child , so he L_moved L_closer , L_trying not to L_breathe , and L_stood L_steadfastly L_looking until he was L_confident of what he had L_seen : a L_body , must be a L_girl because it was L_wearing a L_skirt , L_lying L_face down , L_head towards the L_bottom of the L_embankment as if she had L_dived off the L_top .
He L_clipped the L_lead on to the L_dog with L_cold L_hands which would L_hardly L_function , and L_let her L_pull him up the L_slope as L_fast as he could M_make his L_legs L_move .

He L_stopped on the L_embankment , L_shaking with L_cold and L_shock , to M_note the M_spot , then L_fled along the L_tractor L_paths , the L_dog L_running with him , to the L_stables where the ten o'clock L_children 's L_ride was in its M_closing M_stages .
‘ L_Miss L_Williams ! ’
‘ L_Jamie , I 'm L_teaching . ’
The L_thin , L_capable L_woman who was M_taking the L_riding-class L_looked at him in L_amazement as he L_leaned L_panting on the L_gate to the L_ring , the L_dog M_whining beside him .
‘ I 'm L_sorry .
L_Please , I 've L_found L_something , I must L_tell you .

She had L_known him since he was a very L_small L_five-year-old , M_perched like a M_mosquito on one of the L_placid L_beginners ' L_ponies , so she L_told the L_class to L_carry on L_walking their L_ponies while she L_came to him .
‘ There 's L_someone L_dead .
Below the L_railway L_embankment . ’
‘ Are you L_sure ? ’
The L_boy L_looked at her and L_uncontrollable L_tears L_suddenly M_filled his L_eyes .

He was very L_nearly as L_tall as her , but she L_put an L_arm under his L_shoulders and L_supported him to the L_untidy L_room which M_served as the L_stable L_office , L_calling to one of the L_stable L_girls to L_take over the L_class .
‘ L_Patty L_found her .
She 's just L_lying there , but she is L_dead . ’
He L_scrubbed at his L_face with the L_handkerchief she L_offered and M_gulped for L_air .
‘ I 'll L_ring the L_police . ’
She did so , M_casting an L_experienced L_eye over him .
‘ L_Sit down here , L_Jamie , and I 'll L_make some L_tea .
L_Mummy will L_come L_back in a few L_minutes , wo n't she , for L_Susie ? ’
‘ Not L_Mummy .
L_Aunt L_Margaret is L_coming at ten . ’

The L_boy L_thought L_longingly of his L_mother , but L_managed to L_help L_Miss L_Williams L_describe the L_location of the L_body to a L_startled L_local L_station M_sergeant and to L_drink a L_cup of L_sweet L_milky L_tea without being L_sick .

It 's only a L_headache . ’
L_Millie had her L_reasons for being L_concerned .
The M_petticoat Mafia at the M_top of the L_organisation L_always M_knew what was M_going on , L_often before the M_top L_executives themselves .
L_Millie and the L_secretaries of L_Pat L_Muldoon and L_Clancy L_McGillicuddy were all M_close L_friends .
They had M_got L_together over the L_weekend to L_discuss the L_implications of the L_confidential L_letter the two L_Americans had L_received from L_Randy L_Mueller on L_behalf of L_Nate L_Cocello .
L_Major L_changes were L_afoot which L_affected their L_respective L_bosses .
By the L_time L_Mark M_reached L_home that L_evening , the L_pains in his L_head were L_excruciating .
He L_decided against L_telling L_Georgina about his L_meeting with L_Muldoon .
He would L_wait for the L_right L_moment .
This was n't it .
L_HOMICIDE
This L_chapter M_deals with the M_approach of the L_criminal L_law to L_behaviour which L_causes or M_risks L_causing L_death .

L_Murder , L_manslaughter , and L_several other L_offences are M_discussed , and one L_recurrent L_issue here is whether L_English L_law M_responds M_proportionately to the L_different M_degrees of L_culpability L_manifested in L_cases where L_death is L_caused .
7.1 L_DEATH AND L_FINALITY
For L_practical L_purposes , the M_culpable L_causing of another L_person 's L_death may L_fairly be M_regarded as the most M_serious L_offence in the L_criminal M_calendar .

There is an L_argument that L_treason is a more M_serious L_offence , since it M_strikes at the very M_foundations of the L_State and its L_social L_organizations , but L_treason is so M_rare that it is L_surely L_permissible to L_treat L_homicide as the most M_serious M_form of L_crime .

The L_reason for this is not L_difficult to M_find : the L_harm L_caused by L_many other L_crimes is L_remediable to a M_degree , whereas the L_harm L_caused by L_homicide is L_absolutely L_irremediable .

L_Even in L_crimes of L_violence which M_leave some L_permanent L_physical L_disfigurement or L_psychological L_effects , the L_victim M_retains his or her L_life and , L_therefore , the L_possibility of further L_pleasures and L_achievements , whereas L_death is L_final .

This L_finality M_makes it L_proper to M_regard L_death as the most M_serious L_harm that may be L_inflicted on another , and to M_regard a L_person who L_chooses to L_inflict that L_harm as the most L_culpable of L_offenders , in the L_absence of some L_excuse or L_justification .

Although L_many L_deaths M_arise from L_natural L_causes , and L_many L_others from L_illnesses and L_diseases , each L_year M_sees a M_large L_number of L_deaths L_caused by ‘ L_accidents ’ , and L_also a L_number L_caused by L_acts or L_omissions which M_amount to some M_form of L_homicide in L_English L_law .
For 1987 the L_statistics M_show that there were some 20,000 L_accidental L_deaths , of which some 7,000 L_occurred in the L_home , 6,000 at L_work , and 5,000 on the L_roads .
By L_comparison , the L_number of L_deaths L_recorded as L_criminal L_homicide was 600 , which M_includes all the L_murders and L_manslaughters .
This L_figure is L_relatively M_small when L_compared with L_many L_American L_cities , but that is no L_cause for L_satisfaction .
There are L_still L_awkward L_questions to be M_confronted .
For L_example , are we L_satisfied that the 600 L_deaths L_recorded as L_homicide are in L_fact more M_culpable than all , or L_even most , of the L_deaths L_recorded as L_accidents ?
In other L_words , does L_English L_criminal L_law M_pick out the most L_heinous M_forms of L_killing as L_murders and L_manslaughters , or are the M_boundaries M_frozen by L_tradition ?
Another L_question is whether the L_criminal L_law ought not to be M_wider in its M_application to L_activities which M_carry some L_risk of L_causing L_death than in other M_spheres .

L_Thus , L_even if it would be L_excessive to M_sweep M_large L_numbers of the L_deaths now L_recorded as ‘ L_accidents ’ into the L_law of L_homicide , there may be L_sufficient L_justification for M_creating or L_enforcing L_offences M_designed to L_ensure L_safe L_conditions of L_work , L_safe L_goods , L_safe L_buildings , and so on .
It was L_argued in L_Chapter 2 that the L_criminal L_law ought to M_spread its M_net M_wider where the L_potential L_harm is M_greater .

It will be M_seen that L_English L_law does this up to a M_point , and in the L_process L_seems to M_accept social-defence L_arguments as L_reasons for M_departing from L_several of the L_principles M_set out in L_Chapter 3 .
7.2 L_REQUIREMENTS OF L_CRIMINAL L_HOMICIDE
L_English L_law M_distinguishes between the L_offences of L_murder and L_manslaughter , as we shall L_see , but the two L_crimes do have L_certain L_common M_elements .
It must be L_proved that the L_defendant 's L_act or L_omission L_caused the L_death of the L_victim within a L_year and a L_day .
( The L_requirements of L_causation in the L_criminal L_law are M_discussed M_elsewhere . )

The ‘ L_year and a L_day ’ M_rule is a M_legacy of L_times when L_medical L_science was so L_rudimentary that , if there was a M_substantial L_lapse of L_time between L_injury and L_death , it was L_unsafe to M_pronounce on whether the L_defendant 's L_conduct or some other L_event L_caused the L_death .

L_Nowadays the L_problem is L_quite the M_reverse : L_medical L_science is L_generally M_able to M_determine whether D's L_conduct L_caused the L_death , and L_innovations such as life-support L_machines L_mean that L_life can be L_prolonged for L_months and L_years in some L_instances .
In one L_recent L_case the L_victim of a L_stabbing L_died two and a M_half L_years after the L_incident , having been M_kept on a M_life-support L_machine for L_almost the L_entire L_time .

In L_principle , it L_seems L_unjust that a L_homicide L_conviction should not be L_possible in such a L_case , if all the other M_elements can be L_established and only the ‘ L_year and a L_day ’ M_rule M_stands in the M_way .

But the M_rule was L_confirmed by the L_Criminal L_Law L_Revision L_Committee in 1980 , on the M_ground that a L_defendant should not be M_left in L_peril of a L_homicide L_conviction L_indefinitely .
L_Surely L_prosecutorial L_discretion should be L_enough to L_prevent L_unfair L_convictions L_years after the L_event .
The M_rule itself is out of L_accord with L_modern L_medical L_conditions and should be L_abolished .
M_DEFINING L_MURDER : THE L_INCLUSIONARY L_QUESTION
( a ) The L_Procedural M_Context

If L_causing L_death is to be M_regarded as the most M_serious L_harm that can be L_inflicted , it would L_seem to M_follow that the most L_blameworthy M_form of L_homicide should L_result in the M_highest L_sentences M_imposed by the L_courts .
L_Indeed , L_many M_systems of L_criminal L_law M_impose a L_mandatory L_sentence for L_murder ( or whatever the M_highest M_form of L_homicide is M_called in that M_system ) .
In some L_jurisdictions this is a L_mandatory L_sentence of L_death .
In L_others , such as those in the L_United L_Kingdom , it is the L_mandatory L_sentence of L_life L_imprisonment .
Why should this L_penalty be L_mandatory , and not at the L_discretion of the L_court as in other L_offences ?
One L_argument in L_favour of the L_mandatory L_sentence of L_life L_imprisonment is that it M_amounts to a L_symbolic L_indication of the L_unique L_heinousness of L_murder .
It M_places the L_offender under the L_State 's L_control , as it were , for the L_remainder of his or her L_life .

This is L_often M_linked with a L_supposed L_denunciatory L_effect — the L_idea that the L_mandatory L_life L_sentence M_denounces L_murder as L_emphatically as L_possible — and with a L_supposed L_general L_deterrent L_effect , in M_declaring that there is no L_mitigation of L_sentence L_available for this L_crime .
It might L_also be L_argued that the L_mandatory L_life L_sentence M_makes a M_substantial M_contribution to L_public L_safety .
L_None of these L_arguments is L_notably M_strong , L_let L_alone L_conclusive .

The L_mandatory L_penalty does L_indeed M_serve to M_mark out L_murder from other L_crimes , but whether the L_definition of L_murder is L_sufficiently M_refined to M_capture the L_worst L_killings , and only the L_worst L_killings , M_remains to be M_discussed below .

Whether the L_life L_sentence is M_regarded as a L_sufficient L_denunciation in L_society L_depends on the L_public 's M_perception of what L_life L_imprisonment L_means : if it is L_widely L_believed that it L_results in an L_average of nine L_years ' L_imprisonment , the L_effect will be L_somewhat M_blunted .

The same L_applies to the L_general L_deterrent L_argument : its L_effectiveness L_depends on whether the L_penalty for L_murder L_affects the M_calculations of L_potential L_killers at all , and , if it does , whether L_life L_imprisonment is M_seen as L_significantly more or L_less M_severe than the L_alternative of a M_long , M_fixed-term L_sentence .

As for L_public L_protection , this L_depends on L_executive L_decisions with L_regard to L_release ; it M_fails to M_take into M_account whether it is L_necessary for L_public L_protection to L_keep ‘ L_lifers ’ in for so M_long .
This M_brings the M_discussion to a L_crucial M_point : what does the L_sentence of L_life L_imprisonment L_mean in L_practice , and what would be the L_alternative ?

What it L_means is that the L_time of L_release from L_prison is L_determined by the M_Home L_Secretary , on the L_advice of the L_Parole L_Board and the L_Lord L_Chief L_Justice , L_rather than by the L_judge at the L_trial .

In L_procedural L_terms , L_therefore , the L_life L_sentence L_involves a M_transfer of L_function : L_normally it is the L_judge who L_determines the L_sentence ( or at L_least its M_upper M_limit , since L_earlier L_release on L_parole may be L_possible ) , whereas a L_life L_sentence M_entrusts that L_function to the L_executive , who must L_first L_ascertain the L_opinions of the L_Lord L_Chief L_Justice and the L_trial L_judge .
The L_Home L_Office is not M_bound by those L_opinions , and L_appears to M_depart from them L_frequently .

In 1983 the M_Home L_Secretary L_imposed L_restrictions on the L_release of L_persons M_serving L_life for L_murders of L_police- and L_prison-officers , L_terrorist L_killings , L_murder during L_robbery , and the M_sadistic or L_sexual L_murder of L_young L_children , M_fixing a L_minimum of twenty L_years ' L_imprisonment for these L_offenders .

Whatever the L_justifications for M_introducing this L_policy , it M_serves to M_underline the L_fact that L_sentencing in L_murder L_cases is M_enacted without each L_case being M_considered M_individually , after L_hearing L_representations from the L_offender 's L_counsel , and without a L_sentence L_announced in L_court and L_subject to L_appeal .
At L_present , the L_executive M_takes L_decisions to L_release some L_murderers after only a few L_years and to L_keep L_others in L_prison for L_extremely M_long L_periods .
Should those L_decisions not be M_taken by the L_courts , in the same M_way as other L_sentencing L_decisions ?

The L_answer L_sometimes M_given is that L_murderers should be L_treated L_differently because they are L_particularly L_dangerous : L_anyone who L_chooses to L_kill once can L_choose to L_kill again .

But this L_argument will L_seem L_less M_persuasive when we have M_discussed L_cases of L_manslaughter by L_reason of L_diminished L_responsibility : where a L_murder is M_reduced to L_manslaughter , the L_judge has a M_wide L_sentencing L_discretion and may , L_according to the L_facts of the L_case , L_select a L_determinate L_prison L_sentence , a L_hospital L_order , or L_life L_imprisonment .

Those who L_kill and are L_convicted of L_manslaughter by L_reason of L_diminished L_responsibility are no L_less L_dangerous than those L_convicted of L_murder , and L_yet the L_judge has L_sentencing L_discretion in one L_case and not in the other .

L_Considerations of this L_kind have M_led the L_House of L_Lords L_Select L_Committee on L_Murder and L_Life L_Imprisonment to L_recommend the L_abolition of the L_mandatory L_sentence for L_murder .
In its M_place would be a L_sentencing L_discretion , which L_judges would L_use , in L_many L_cases , to M_mark the L_relative L_heinousness of the L_murder by a L_determinate L_prison L_sentence .

In L_cases where L_life L_imprisonment was L_thought to be the L_appropriate L_sentence , the L_trial L_judge would L_still L_specify — in M_open L_court — the L_number of L_years to be M_spent in L_prison , M_taking the M_gravity of the L_offence into M_account , and L_release would be M_determined by a L_judicial L_tribunal .
Such a L_reform would M_bring L_improvements in L_natural L_justice without M_loss of L_public L_protection .
( b ) M_Degrees of L_Homicide
L_English L_criminal L_law has two M_degrees of L_homicide , L_murder and L_manslaughter .

L_Many L_American L_jurisdictions have three M_degrees of L_murder — M_first-degree L_murder , L_requiring L_premeditation , and L_second- and M_third-degree L_murder , M_covering L_lesser M_shades of L_culpability .
In L_England there has been a L_proposal that we should do L_away with all these L_distinctions , M_leaving a L_single L_offence of L_criminal L_homicide .

That L_proposal , if L_implemented , would M_shift L_almost all the L_decision-making in L_homicide L_cases from the L_trial to the L_sentencing M_stage : the only L_issue of any L_consequence in most L_cases would be the L_sentence to be L_imposed , and all the L_distinctions now M_drawn at the M_stage of L_criminal L_liability would be M_reflected in the L_sentence L_alone .
The L_jury would have no M_role in most L_homicide L_cases , since a L_plea of L_guilty would be the L_norm .

L_Contrast this with the M_position in L_jurisdictions where there are three or more M_degrees of L_homicide : L_pleas of L_guilty to L_first- and second-degree L_murders would be L_less L_frequent , since there would be the L_possibility of L_argument in L_court ( if no M_bargain was M_struck L_beforehand between L_prosecution and L_defence ) , and the L_defence might M_succeed in L_persuading the L_jury to M_reduce the M_degree of the L_killing .
L_Moreover , the M_borderlines between the L_various M_degrees would M_raise L_questions of L_law , which would L_provide L_much L_opportunity for L_legal L_argument and for L_appeals .
The L_result would be that L_killings were L_classified and M_labelled in a more M_refined M_way , but at the M_cost of L_lengthy L_trials and L_mounting L_legal-aid M_bills .
That M_cost is not L_difficult to L_justify where M_capital L_punishment is the L_penalty for M_first-degree L_murder .

Where there is no L_capital L_punishment , L_however , the L_question of how L_many M_degrees of L_homicide it is L_desirable to have M_calls for M_careful M_weighing of the L_principle of L_fair M_labelling ( L_see L_Chapter 3.3 ( l ) ) against the M_cost and L_time L_arguments M_mobilised by the L_policy of L_efficient L_administration ( L_see L_Chapter 3.3 ( m ) ) .
The M_structure of the L_English L_law of L_homicide is L_rather L_strange .

Although there are two L_offences , L_murder and L_manslaughter , the L_latter M_includes two M_distinct L_varieties : ‘ L_voluntary ’ L_manslaughter ( L_killings which would be L_murder but for the L_existence of M_defined L_extenuating L_circumstances ) ; and ‘ L_involuntary ’ L_manslaughter ( L_killings for which there is no L_need to L_prove any L_awareness of the L_risk of L_death being L_caused , but for which there is L_thought to be L_sufficient L_fault to L_justify L_criminal L_liability ) .
The L_arguments L_therefore M_tend to M_focus on three L_borderline L_questions : What is the L_minimum L_fault L_required for L_conviction of L_murder ?
What L_conditions are L_needed to M_reduce L_murder to L_manslaughter ?
And what is the L_minimum L_fault L_required for a L_conviction of L_manslaughter .
( c ) L_Requirements for L_Murder
In L_English L_criminal L_law there are now two L_alternative L_fault L_requirements for L_murder : an L_intent to L_kill , or an L_intent to L_cause L_grievous L_bodily L_harm .
What do these L_requirements L_mean ?
Do they M_extend the L_definition of L_murder too M_far , or are they too M_narrow .
L_Intent to L_kill may be M_regarded as the most L_obvious and L_indisputable M_form of L_fault M_element for L_murder , but to some M_extent that L_depends on the L_meaning of ‘ L_intent ’ .
This has been the M_subject of a L_number of L_House of L_Lords L_decisions , and L_yet the L_definition is L_still not M_clear and M_settled .

L_Probably the most L_accurate L_statement would be that a L_person L_intends to L_kill if it is his or her L_purpose to L_kill by the L_act or L_omission M_charged , or if he or she L_foresees that L_death is L_practically L_certain to M_follow from that L_act or L_omission .

In this M_way , both L_purpose and L_foresight of L_practical L_certainty are M_regarded as M_part of the L_definition of L_intent , although there are other L_statements M_suggesting that L_foresight of L_practical or ‘ L_virtual ’ L_certainty is L_merely L_evidence from which L_intent may be L_inferred .
How would this L_test be M_applied ?
In L_many L_cases the L_word ‘ L_intent ’ is L_used without L_elaboration , but there are some for which a M_full L_explanation of the L_meaning of L_intention is L_necessary .
A L_fairly L_typical M_set of L_facts is L_provided by L_Nedrick ( 1986 ) , where D had a L_grudge against a L_woman and had L_threatened to ‘ L_burn her out ’ .
One L_night he L_went to her L_house , L_poured L_paraffin through the L_letter-box and on to the L_front L_door , and M_set it L_alight .
One of the L_woman 's L_children L_died in the L_ensuing L_fire .
When L_asked why he did it , D L_replied : ‘ Just to L_wake her up and L_frighten her . ’
A M_defence of this L_kind , a M_claim that the L_purpose was only to L_frighten and not to L_cause L_harm , L_requires the L_full L_definition to be M_put to the L_jury .

The L_question is : L_granted that D's L_purpose was to L_frighten , did he L_nonetheless L_realize that it was L_practically L_certain that his L_act would L_cause L_death or L_grievous L_bodily L_harm to L_someone ?
The L_jury should L_answer this by M_drawing L_inferences from the L_evidence in the L_case and from the M_surrounding L_circumstances .
What about the L_alternative M_element in the L_definition , an L_intent to L_cause L_grievous L_bodily L_harm ?
This has L_considerable L_practical L_importance , since this is all that the L_prosecution has to L_prove in L_order to L_obtain a L_verdict of L_guilty of L_murder .
It must be M_shown that the L_defendant L_intended ( which , again , M_includes both L_purpose and L_awareness of L_practical L_certainty ) to L_cause L_really L_serious L_injury to L_someone .

The L_House of L_Lords M_confirmed this M_rule in L_Cunningham ( 1981 ) : D L_struck his L_victim on the L_head a L_number of L_times with a L_chair , L_causing L_injuries from which the L_victim L_died a L_week L_later .

D M_maintained throughout that he had not L_intended to L_kill , but there was L_evidence from which the L_jury could L_infer — and did L_infer — that he L_intended to L_cause L_grievous L_bodily L_harm .

The L_House of L_Lords M_upheld D 's L_conviction for L_murder : an L_intent to L_cause L_really M_serious L_injury is L_sufficient for L_murder , without any L_proof that the L_defendant L_intended , or L_even M_contemplated , the L_possibility that L_death would L_result .
Does the ‘ L_grievous L_bodily L_harm ’ M_rule M_extend the L_definition of L_murder too M_far ?

If the M_point of L_distinguishing L_murder from L_manslaughter is to M_mark out the most L_heinous L_group of L_killings for the L_extra L_stigma of a L_murder L_conviction , it can be L_argued that the ‘ L_grievous L_bodily L_harm ’ M_rule M_draws the M_line too M_low .

In L_terms of L_principle , the M_rule L_requires L_justification because it M_departs from the L_principle of L_correspondence ( L_see L_Chapter 5.2(a) ) , L_namely that the L_fault M_element in a L_crime should L_relate to the L_consequences L_prohibited by that L_crime .

By M_allowing an L_intent to L_cause L_grievous L_bodily L_harm to L_suffice for a L_murder L_conviction , the L_law is M_violating a L_general L_principle , M_turning the most M_serious of its L_offences into a M_constructive L_crime .
Why should it be L_necessary to ‘ M_construct ’ a L_murder L_conviction out of this L_lesser L_intent ?

There are L_arguments in L_favour of this : L_death is M_final , L_murder is the L_gravest L_crime , and there is no M_significant L_moral L_difference between L_someone who L_chooses to L_cause L_really L_serious L_injury and L_someone who M_sets out to L_kill .

No L_one can L_predict whether a L_serious L_injury will L_result in L_death — that may L_depend on the L_victim 's L_physique , on the L_speed of an L_ambulance , on the L_distance from the L_hospital , and on a M_range of other L_medical and L_individual L_matters .

If one L_person L_chooses to L_cause M_serious L_injury to another , it should be L_presumed that he or she L_realizes that there is L_always a L_risk of L_death , and such L_cases M_show a L_sufficiently M_wanton L_disregard for L_life as to L_warrant the M_label ‘ L_murder ’ if L_death L_results .

The L_counter-arguments , which would M_uphold the L_principle of L_correspondence , are that M_breach of that L_principle is L_unnecessary when the M_amplitude of the L_crime of L_manslaughter M_lies beneath L_murder , and L_also that the L_definition of L_grievous L_bodily L_harm M_includes a L_number of L_injuries which are most L_unlikely to M_put the L_victim 's L_life at L_risk .

In the M_leading L_case of L_Cunningham L_Lord L_Edmund-Davies ( L_dissenting ) M_gave the L_example of L_breaking L_someone 's L_arm : that is a L_really M_serious L_injury , but one which is L_unlikely to L_endanger the L_victim 's L_life .
So in L_practice the ‘ L_grievous L_bodily L_harm ’ M_rule M_goes further than the L_arguments of its M_protagonists would M_support .
Would it be L_right , then , to M_confine the L_fault M_element in L_murder to an L_intent to L_kill ?
That would have the L_merit of L_simplicity , but would it M_strike the L_right M_note L_socially ?

There are M_powerful L_arguments in L_favour of L_saying that there are other L_killings where an L_intent to L_kill can not be L_established , and L_yet where the L_moral or L_social L_culpability is L_equal to that in most L_intentional L_killings .

Of L_course , one can not be L_adamant about whether they L_merit the M_label ‘ L_murder ’ , because that is a L_question of M_drawing the M_line between L_murder and L_manslaughter , which is not L_susceptible of any L_precise L_resolution .

It is M_hard to L_argue L_conclusively that the L_category of L_murder should be M_smaller or M_larger ( unless the L_death L_penalty or a L_mandatory L_life L_sentence M_follows ) ; it is a L_question of L_social L_judgment .
L_Let us L_briefly M_consider some of the L_possibilities .
The L_fault M_element for L_many M_serious L_offences is L_intent or L_recklessness : why should this not L_suffice for L_murder ?
The L_question is whether all L_killings in which the L_defendant is L_aware of the L_risk of L_death are L_sufficiently M_serious to L_warrant the L_term ‘ L_murder ’ .

One L_answer L_sometimes M_given is that they are not , because a L_driver who L_overtakes on a L_bend , L_knowingly M_taking the L_risk that there is a L_car L_travelling in the M_opposite L_direction , should not be M_labelled a L_murderer if a L_collision and L_death L_happen to L_ensue .
This L_example M_assumes that a L_sympathy for L_motorists with M_overwhelm any L_tendency to L_logical L_analysis .
One might L_ask whether L_motorists are L_ever L_justified in L_knowingly M_taking L_risks with other L_people 's L_lives .

L_Yet if the L_example is M_modified a L_little , so that the L_overtaking is on a L_country L_road at L_night and the L_risk is L_known to be M_slight , it L_becomes L_questionable whether the L_causing of L_death in these L_circumstances should be M_labelled in the same M_way as L_intentional L_killings .
This is not to L_suggest that L_motorists should be L_treated L_differently .

The M_point is L_rather that , L_even though L_knowingly M_taking L_risks with other L_people 's L_lives is L_usually L_unjustifiable , M_taking a M_slight L_risk is L_less M_serious than L_intentionally L_causing L_death .
In M_discussing the M_boundaries of L_murder , we are L_concerned with L_classification , not L_exculpation .

To L_classify all L_reckless L_killings as L_murder might be too M_broad , but the M_point M_remains that some L_reckless L_killings may be L_thought no L_less L_heinous than L_intentional L_killings .
Can a L_satisfactory M_line be M_drawn here ?
One M_approach would be to M_draw the M_line by L_reference to the M_degree of L_probability .
L_Murder is L_committed in those M_situations where D L_caused L_death by an L_act or L_omission which he L_knew had L_death as the L_probable or L_highly L_probable L_result .
A L_version of this L_test of L_foresight of M_high L_probability is L_used in L_several other L_European L_countries ; it was M_introduced into L_English L_law by the L_decision in L_Hyam v.
L_DPP ( 1975 ) , but M_abandoned in L_Moloney ( 1985 ) on M_grounds of L_uncertainty .
A L_second M_approach is to M_frame the L_law in such a M_way as to M_make it M_clear that the L_court should M_make a L_moral L_judgment on the L_gravity of the L_defendant 's L_conduct .
M_Section 210.2 of the Model L_Penal L_Code M_includes within L_murder those L_reckless L_killings which L_manifest ‘ M_extreme L_indifference to the M_value of L_human L_life ’ .
L_Scots L_law M_treats as L_murder L_killings with ‘ M_wicked L_recklessness ’ , a L_phrase which M_directs the L_court 's L_attention to the L_circumstances of the L_killing .

Both the Model L_Penal L_Code L_test and the L_Scots L_test may be M_reduced to L_circularity , L_however , for when L_one L_asks how M_extreme or how M_wicked the L_recklessness should be , the only L_possible L_answer is : ‘ M_wicked or M_extreme L_enough to L_justify the L_stigma of a L_murder L_conviction ’ .

L_Admittedly , the Model L_Penal L_Code does M_contain a L_list of L_circumstances which may M_amount to M_extreme L_indifference , which M_assists the L_courts and M_increases the L_predictability of L_verdicts in a M_way that L_Scots L_law does not , but the M_essence of both M_approaches is that there is no L_precise M_way of L_describing those L_non-intentional L_killings which are as L_heinous as L_intentional L_killings .

Their M_protagonists L_argue that the L_law of L_murder is so L_important L_socially that L_derogation from the L_principle of L_maximum L_certainty should be L_allowed in L_favour of more L_accurate M_labelling by the L_courts ; M_opponents L_argue that the L_principle of L_maximum L_certainty is L_needed here L_specifically to M_reduce the L_risk of L_verdicts L_based on L_discriminatory or L_irrelevant L_factors , such as L_distaste for the L_defendant 's M_background , L_allegiance , or other L_activities .

A L_third , more L_precise M_formulation M_derives from the L_recommendations of the L_Criminal L_Law L_Revision L_Committee in 1980 , L_namely , that a L_killing should be L_classified as L_murder in those M_situations where there is an L_intention to L_cause M_serious L_injury L_coupled with L_awareness of the L_risk of L_death .

Neither an L_intention to L_cause L_serious L_injury nor L_recklessness as to L_death should be L_sufficient on its own , but L_together they M_restrict one another , M_producing a L_test which both M_satisfies the L_criterion of L_certainty and M_marks out some L_heinous but L_non-intended L_killings .

A L_fourth M_approach , M_adopted by L_English M_law until 1957 and L_still in M_force in L_many L_American L_jurisdictions , is some M_form of L_felony-murder L_rule : L_anyone who L_kills during the M_course of a L_felony ( or , more L_restrictively , a L_serious L_crime of L_violence ) or whilst L_resisting L_arrest should be L_convicted of L_murder .

L_Thus L_stated , there is no L_reference to the L_defendant 's L_intention or L_awareness of the L_risks : the L_fact that D has L_chosen to L_commit L_rape , L_robbery , or another M_serious L_offence , and has L_caused L_death L_thereby , is M_held to L_constitute L_sufficient L_moral M_grounds for M_placing the L_killing in the M_highest L_category .
L_Plainly , this is a M_form of M_constructive L_criminal L_liability : the L_murder L_conviction is M_constructed out of the M_ingredients of a L_lesser L_offence .

L_Presumably the L_justification is that D has L_already M_crossed a M_high moral/social M_threshold in L_choosing to L_commit such a M_serious L_offence , and should L_therefore be M_held L_liable for whatever L_consequences L_ensue , L_however L_unforeseeable they may be .

The L_objections would be M_reduced if L_awareness of the L_risk of L_death was L_also L_required : in other L_words , if the L_test were the L_commission of a M_serious L_offence of L_violence plus L_recklessness as to L_death .

The L_effect of that L_test would be to L_pick out those L_reckless L_killings which L_occurred when D had L_already L_manifested M_substantial L_moral and L_legal L_culpability , and to L_classify them as L_murder .
Four L_alternative M_approaches have been L_described , and L_many L_others could be L_listed .

The M_point is that the L_traditional L_concepts of L_intention and L_recklessness do not , of themselves , L_appear to be L_sufficiently L_well M_focused to M_mark out those L_killings which are the most L_heinous .
The L_law must M_resort to some L_kind of L_moral and L_social L_evaluation of L_conduct if it is to M_identify and M_separate out the most L_heinous L_killings .

L_Many L_people might L_think that a L_person who L_causes L_death whilst L_using an L_unlawfully L_held L_firearm or L_explosives ought to be L_convicted of L_murder because there is , L_generally L_speaking , no L_excuse for L_using such L_dangerous L_equipment .
Some of the L_people L_thus M_covered would be L_armed L_robbers , L_others would be L_terrorists .

The L_armed L_robber might L_say that he had no L_intention of L_using the L_firearm , that he L_carried it with him L_simply to L_frighten the L_victim , and that it L_went off L_accidentally : if the L_jury L_believes that , should he be L_convicted of L_murder ?
L_Property : Do n't M_let yourself in for L_trouble L_Choosing the L_right L_agent is L_essential if you L_want to L_rent your L_property .
L_Francesca L_Simon L_describes some of the L_pitfalls — and how to M_avoid them
By L_FRANCESCA L_SIMON

By L_CHRISTOPHER L_SOMERVILLE
