L_Latest L_corporate L_unbundler M_reveals L_laid-back M_approach : L_Roland L_Franklin , who is M_leading a 697m L_pound L_break-up L_bid for L_DRG , L_talks to L_Frank L_Kane
By L_FRANK L_KANE

IT L_SEEMS that L_Roland L_Franklin , the L_latest L_unbundler to L_appear in the L_UK , has M_made a M_fatal L_error in the L_preparation of his £697m L_break-up L_bid for L_stationery and L_packaging L_group L_DRG .
He has not L_properly L_investigated the M_target 's L_dining L_facilities .

The 63-year-old M_head of L_Pembridge L_Investments , through which the L_bid is being M_mounted L_says , ‘ M_rule L_number one in this L_business is : the more L_luxurious the L_luncheon L_rooms at M_headquarters , the more L_inefficient the L_business ’ .
If he had M_taken his own L_rule L_seriously , he would have L_found out that L_DRG has a very M_modest L_self-service L_canteen at its L_Bristol M_head L_office .

There are other M_things he has , on his own M_admission , not L_fully L_investigated , like the L_value of the L_DRG L_properties , or which M_part of the L_DRG L_business he would M_keep after the L_break up .
When the L_bid was M_launched L_last L_week , L_Mr L_Franklin M_faced some L_criticism from L_City L_commentators on both those M_counts .
He M_regards the M_charges as L_unfounded .
On L_property , he is M_blunt .
‘ I do not M_regard L_property L_profits as L_earnings .

We have M_made a L_bid of L_nearly £700m for a L_company with a L_book L_value of £200m — we 've L_acknowledged there is some L_extra L_worth there , but I can not M_see the L_sort of L_value they are L_talking about in L_property .
If they can L_prove it is there , we might L_pay for it , ’
On the other L_criticism he is L_equally L_dismissive .
‘ That M_point about the L_core L_business is very L_unfair , ’ he L_says .
It is L_difficult to L_decide when you are an L_outsider what the L_business is L_like .
We would L_eventually L_like to do it along with the L_management , within the L_philosophy we will L_impose . ’
The L_Franklin L_philosophy was L_learnt in the L_US L_leveraged L_buyout L_business at the M_side of L_Sir L_James L_Goldsmith .
L_Mr L_Franklin L_went there at the M_end of the 1970s , after the M_collapse of L_Keyser L_Ullman , the L_merchant L_bank where he was a L_director that was L_rescued by the L_Bank of L_England .
He M_feels that L_Keyser 's L_problems were L_hastened by an L_unwise L_acquisition .
He L_went to the L_US because ‘ L_Goldsmith L_decided that if you L_wanted to be a L_capitalist the L_UK and L_France were not the L_places to be ’ .
Along with L_Sir L_James he M_found the L_US L_much more M_attractive , L_taking over and M_breaking up some L_fairly M_hefty L_US L_corporations .
He L_rejects M_charges that he was L_partly L_responsible for the ‘ M_casino M_atmosphere ’ that M_gripped L_US L_corporate M_life in the L_early 1980s .
‘ We M_stirred it up , yes , but we L_never M_lost any L_money for L_anybody and we L_never M_added to the L_unemployment L_figures . ’
What he has L_learned from L_Goldsmith ( ‘ the only L_genius I have L_ever M_come across ’ ) is that the L_holding L_company is not the most L_important L_unit of L_corporate L_organisation .
‘ The L_concept of the L_company does not L_interest me - it 's the L_businesses that are L_important .
It does not L_matter whether or not L_DRG M_makes L_sellotape or L_Basildon L_Bond — it 's of no L_consequence to L_anybody if L_somebody L_else L_makes them . ’
And there is L_always the L_ultimate L_unbundler 's M_defence — that he will M_make L_money for his L_backers .

In a L_takeover L_campaign that has L_already M_seen L_vitriolic L_language , he L_responds to the M_charge that he is M_mounting the L_bid to L_enrich himself and his L_friends by L_saying : ‘ L_Nobody could M_take that as a L_criticism — this is an L_investor L_group .
It would be a L_criticism if I was doing it to L_impoverish myself ’ .
L_Letter : L_Policy and L_politics at the L_Labour L_Party L_Conference
From L_MR L_DAVID L_SOSKIN

L_Sir : I was L_interested by your L_juxtaposition of ‘ L_Poll M_predicts 42-seat L_majority for L_Labour ’ with ‘ L_Tories M_hold on ’ ( 30 L_September ) , the L_latter L_referring , of L_course , to the L_Conservative L_victory in L_Wandsworth , the L_significance of which M_appears to have been L_almost L_totally L_ignored by the L_media .

L_Electors are L_always M_prepared to L_criticise the L_Government in L_answer to L_pollsters ' L_questions , but when the same L_individuals L_arrive at the L_polling L_booth they L_simply can not M_bring themselves to L_vote L_Labour into M_power .
L_Letter : L_Policy and L_politics at the L_Labour L_Party L_Conference
From L_MS L_MOLLY L_MEACHER

L_Sir : Despite a L_significant M_gap in the L_Labour L_Party 's L_education and L_training L_proposals , their L_objective to L_double the L_number of 16-18year-olds in L_full-time L_education must be M_welcomed ( 28 L_September ) .
L_England 's L_full-time staying-on L_rate M_stands at 28 per L_cent L_according to the L_latest L_statistics L_available .
This L_compares with 79 per L_cent in the L_US , 86 per L_cent in L_Sweden , 45 per L_cent in L_West L_Germany and 69 per L_cent in L_Japan .
To M_add the L_part-time L_education and L_training L_statistics to those L_figures does not L_improve our L_relative M_position .

L_Labour M_hopes to L_transform the M_situation by L_increasing the L_number of M_A-levels to five for the M_brighter L_youngsters and L_providing L_grants for L_four-year L_training M_courses ( two L_years in a Further L_Education L_college M_followed by two with an L_employer ) for the L_rest .

These L_reforms will only M_achieve their L_objective if M_accompanied by the L_implementation of the 1944 L_Education L_Act L_provision for L_compulsory L_part- or L_full-time L_education or L_training up to the L_age of 18 .
This L_clause has L_never L_yet been M_activated .

The L_sharply L_reduced L_number of 16-18-year-olds will L_inevitably M_lead L_employers to L_bid up the L_wages of that L_age M_group to L_entice L_young L_people M_away from L_education and into M_unskilled or M_semi-skilled L_jobs .
L_Employers must be L_required to M_release 16-18-year-olds for L_education and L_training for at L_least two L_days per L_week .

Only then will two L_vitally L_important and L_complementary M_goals be L_achieved : to L_improve L_Britain 's L_general L_educational and M_vocational L_competence , and L_hence our M_productive L_capacity ; and to M_reduce our L_gross L_educational L_inequalities between the L_elite who L_receive a M_narrow L_education to a very M_high M_standard , and the L_rest .
L_Letter : L_Policy and L_politics at the L_Labour L_Party L_Conference
From L_MR L_JOHN L_PERTWEE
L_Sir : L_Labour does not M_need a L_commitment to L_proportional L_representation in L_order to M_scoop most of the M_centre M_ground at the M_next L_general L_election .

All it M_needs is to L_promise a L_high-powered L_investigation , such as a L_Royal L_Commission , into the L_practicalities of an L_alternative L_voting M_system ( L_surely L_justified by the L_intense L_public L_interest now L_abounding ) .
Such a L_promise would be the only L_hope of a L_breakthrough for the L_disenfranchised L_voters and would have them L_flocking to the L_polls for L_Mr L_Kinnock .
His L_problem will be that L_Mrs L_Thatcher might L_decide to do it L_first , and then she will L_garner the L_votes .
L_Letter : L_Policy and L_politics at the L_Labour L_Party L_Conference
From L_MR L_DENIS L_MacSHANE

L_Sir : If L_Labour is to L_suggest the M_setting up of a L_specialist L_labour L_court ( 30 L_September ) , then such a L_momentous L_change in the L_industrial L_relations M_system M_deserves more L_discussion , and M_needs to be M_taken out of the M_hot-house of L_Labour L_Party L_conference L_politics .
For three L_reasons such a M_move should be M_welcomed .

L_First , it would M_bring L_Britain into L_line with the L_best L_European L_practice , L_notably in L_Germany where L_local , L_regional and L_federal L_labour L_courts M_handle L_problems in a M_fair , L_dispassionate M_way M_based on L_law , L_precedent and L_judicial L_expertise in the L_labour M_field .
L_Second , it would L_ensure that L_workers M_enjoyed L_positive M_rights under L_law and M_reduce the M_emphasis of L_union M_immunities .

L_Labour L_law will L_always M_reflect the M_balance of M_power in L_society , and a M_fully M_fledged L_labour L_court M_system will not M_remove L_class and L_fundamental L_employer-employee L_differences .
But it should be L_possible to L_create and L_enforce L_enough L_common L_rules to L_prevent the L_absurd M_see-sawing of L_industrial L_relations L_legislation we have M_seen since 1969 .
L_Third , a L_labour L_division of the M_High L_Court would L_contribute to the L_process of M_constitutional L_reform in L_Britain which L_surely is to be a L_key L_political L_issue in the 1990s .
The ‘ L_trade L_union L_question ’ would L_cease to M_haunt the L_Labour L_Party and while that might M_upset some L_Conservatives it would be L_good for the L_country .
L_Letter : L_Independence of no-fixed-abode
From The L_Rev L_NERISSA L_JONES
L_Sir : On L_Saturday you L_published an L_advertisement for the 10 L_extra L_pages of L_news and L_features that you , The L_Independent , will M_carry from 2 L_October .
‘ What do L_independent L_experts L_say about our 10 L_extra L_pages ? ’ M_asks the L_advertisement .

The L_supposedly L_jokey L_answers are M_illustrated by L_photographs of L_people L_sleeping outside L_covered by L_copies of The L_Independent : they L_look like some of the M_hundreds of M_visitors who M_come to M_St M_Botolph 's M_Crypt M_Centre for M_homeless M_people every M_day .

L_Given the L_already L_appalling and L_growing L_rate of L_homelessness and L_lack of L_hostel L_facilities in L_London , when more L_people than L_ever will not only have to L_endure the L_freezing L_nights of the L_coming L_winter on the L_streets , but L_perhaps L_permanent L_homelessness , it was L_terrible to L_see the M_situation being M_exploited for a L_joke by your L_advertisement : ‘ Just the M_thing now the L_evenings are M_drawing in .
. ‘ ; ‘ The L_added L_coverage is L_exactly what I L_wanted ’ .

L_Letter : L_EC L_immigration L_checks on L_trains
From The L_Rev J. L_GILMORE
L_Sir : The M_contents of L_Sarah L_Helm 's L_article ‘ L_Immigration L_checks to be M_made on L_trains ’ ( 25 L_September ) are L_extremely L_worrying .
During the L_recent L_European L_Community L_elections the L_representatives of L_EC L_governments M_promoted the L_ideal of a L_border-free L_Europe by 1992 .
Now , it would M_appear from this L_article , that this L_ideal is M_shattered and a two-tiered L_Europe is on the M_cards .
One for those who L_travel by L_aircraft and one for those who L_travel by L_train between L_London and L_Paris .

The L_presence of L_immigration L_officials and L_police on L_board L_trains is L_comparable to the M_scenes of 1930s L_America where L_migrant L_labourers were L_turned L_back at L_state L_boundaries .
What L_criteria would L_police and L_immigration L_officials L_use in their L_search for ‘ L_potential L_terrorists ’ on a L_train that they could not L_use at a L_static L_checkpoint or L_airport ?
Do L_terrorists or L_illegal L_persons L_travel L_exclusively by L_train ?

This is a M_clear L_example of the M_extension of the L_Prevention of L_Terrorism L_Act where L_criteria for L_stopping , L_questioning and L_searching are L_purely L_subjective to the L_official L_involved .
Will a L_person 's L_accent , L_dress or L_skin L_colour L_indicate the L_potential L_terrorist or , for that L_matter , L_football L_hooligan or L_drug L_pusher ?
This is a M_recipe for L_fear and L_anxiety .
It may L_mean the L_detention of L_innocent L_people and L_indeed their L_imprisonment .

From L_Mr L_JIMMY L_DONOGHUE

L_Latecomers who L_continue to L_hope
From L_ANNE L_APPLEBAUM in L_Warsaw

L_DOZENS more L_East L_German L_refugees L_arrived outside the L_West L_German L_embassy L_yesterday L_seeking L_asylum and L_passage to the L_West , L_including some who M_missed by only a few L_minutes a L_train that M_took more than 800 of their L_compatriots to L_West L_Germany .
L_Many of the L_new L_arrivals , who L_waited in the L_street outside the L_embassy , L_said they were L_convinced there would be another L_train for them .
The one they M_missed M_pulled out from L_Warsaw 's L_East L_Station at 2.50am L_yesterday M_carrying 809 L_cheering L_East L_Germans M_bound for the L_Rhine L_region of L_West L_Germany .
Once upon a L_time another L_German L_government L_let L_Lenin L_cross another L_Germany in a L_sealed L_train on his L_way to L_Russia .

More than 80 L_years L_later , L_Lenin 's L_heirs are L_allowing L_refugees from their L_Communist L_regime L_escape in the L_opposite L_direction , in an L_East L_German-made L_train L_travelling across L_East L_German L_territory .
Among those L_leaving was L_Cornelia , 22 , a L_young L_East L_Berliner L_destined , she L_said , for L_West L_Berlin via a very L_circuitous L_route .
‘ I L_still do n't L_know if my L_family L_know where I am or if they will L_suffer from my L_decision .
But I M_saw no other M_way out : I did n't L_know if I would L_ever have a L_chance again . ’

Some of the L_refugees had been L_living in L_Polish L_exile for as L_long as seven L_weeks , while L_others L_arrived only a few L_hours before L_West L_German L_diplomats L_announced they could L_leave .

There 's no L_reason why they should n't be L_funny or L_gripping L_even if they do n't M_use L_many L_words . ’

L_Writing L_books for L_children is L_becoming L_increasingly L_complex , as the L_arbiters of the L_modern L_child 's mores — L_librarians , L_teachers and L_publishers — M_lay down L_ever more L_stringent L_criteria .

The M_revolution the L_countryside L_needs : L_Christian L_Wolmar L_says L_Britain is M_lagging M_behind in M_setting up ‘ L_telecottages ’
By L_CHRISTIAN L_WOLMAR
THE L_information L_technology M_revolution has M_left L_large L_swaths of L_rural L_Britain M_untouched .

This M_clever L_name , with its M_neat L_evocation of L_new and L_old , M_describes a L_concept which was L_developed in L_Sweden and is M_spreading to L_rural L_areas across the L_world .
In L_Mr L_Dobbs 's L_words , a L_telecottage is ‘ a L_room in a L_village L_filled with L_computer L_communications that can be L_used by L_local L_people to L_learn and L_work ’ .

But they are L_interested in L_working .

By OLIVIA TIMBS
L_FADS for L_vitamin L_supplements have been M_overtaken by a L_vogue for L_minerals and M_trace L_elements .

Further L_studies , the L_researchers L_believe , should M_concentrate on L_pregnant L_women L_known to have a L_zinc L_deficiency or to be at L_risk from L_problems during L_labour .
L_Health : L_Alternative L_cures ‘ not L_proven ’
By OLIVIA TIMBS
L_RENEE L_HENRY L_underwent a L_lumpectomy and L_radiotherapy for her L_breast L_cancer .

L_Dr L_Maurice L_Slevin , a L_consultant L_physician at the M_department of L_medical L_oncology at L_St L_Bartholomew 's L_Hospital , L_London , L_said the L_chances of a L_woman being L_alive and L_well four L_years after such L_treatment were at L_least 75 per L_cent .

M_Part of the M_attraction of L_alternative L_cancer L_treatments such as the L_Gerson L_therapy is that they M_allow a L_patient to M_feel more in M_control of the L_treatment .

Very few have been L_evaluated , and the L_evidence is L_largely L_anecdotal , he L_said .
Some of the L_treatments have M_dramatic L_side-effects .
‘ If they do M_work , that is L_wonderful — but we have no M_way of L_knowing for L_sure .
There have been no M_controlled M_trials of the L_Gerson L_therapy .
‘ If one of my L_patients L_wants to L_give up a L_potentially L_curative L_treatment in L_favour of an L_alternative L_therapy , then I will L_try to L_dissuade them .
But it is L_essentially upto the L_patient . ’

The L_Imperial L_Cancer L_Research L_Fund and the L_Cancer L_Research M_Campaign are M_conducting a L_joint L_study of the L_Bristol L_Cancer L_Help M_Centre , which M_offers a L_holistic L_programme — L_dietary L_advice and L_emotional L_counselling — to L_complement L_medical L_treatment .

L_Media : M_Return of the L_six-gun L_saga : L_Modern L_actors can not L_ride and L_young L_viewers do not L_understand the L_cowboy M_code , but a L_revival of the L_western M_looms on the M_horizon , L_John L_Lichfield L_says
By L_JOHN L_LICHFIELD
Where are the L_TV L_westerns of L_yesteryear ?
What L_happened to L_Ben L_Cartwright , L_Hoss and L_Little L_Joe ?
Where is the L_Wagon L_Train that L_seemed L_permanently to be L_circling its L_wagons M_waiting for a L_drunken L_pioneer 's L_wife to have L_twins in the L_last of them ?

The L_TV L_western L_seemed to M_fade into the M_sunset some L_time in the mid-1970s , M_victim of a M_narcissistic L_age that M_preferred to M_look at M_prosperous , M_smart-alecky or M_violent L_images of itself ( L_Dallas , L_Cheers , L_Miami L_Vice ) .
It was a L_time when L_children were L_encouraged to L_fantasize about L_machines and outer L_space L_rather than L_marvel at the L_open L_spaces where the L_deer and L_buffalo L_roamed .
Now , L_however , it L_seems , the M_wheel has M_turned M_full M_circle .
The L_western is being M_revived , M_reinterpreted for the 1990s .
One of the most L_successful L_Hollywood L_TV L_producers , L_David L_Jacobs , the L_creator of L_Dallas , L_believes the L_western L_also M_fell M_victim to L_late 1960s L_iconoclasm .
‘ The L_John L_Wayne L_stereotype was L_rejected , along with his L_conservative M_values , ’ he L_said .

A L_series of L_spoof or L_obsessively L_realistic 1960s L_westerns ( L_Cat L_Balou , L_Butch L_Cassidy and the L_Sundance L_Kid , L_Soldier L_Blue , The L_Wild L_Bunch ) M_stripped the M_mask from the L_Lone L_Ranger 's L_face .
The L_legend could not be M_taken L_seriously any L_longer in what had been , L_admittedly , a M_threadbare M_form .
L_Howard L_Rosenberg , L_TV L_critic of the L_Los L_Angeles L_Times , L_said : ‘ Just L_look at the L_re-runs of the M_old L_western L_series .
You had L_heroes L_scotch-taped to their L_horses and M_lightly L_sprinkled with L_dust .
You ca n't M_get M_away with that any more . ’
L_John L_Mantley , L_producer of L_Gunsmoke for L_CBS for 11 L_years , L_says M_elements of the M_old L_story L_began to M_fall M_apart .
‘ We all L_read L_Bury My L_Heart at L_Wounded L_Knee .
We L_knew that the L_US L_Government had M_signed 453 L_treaties with the L_Indians and M_broken every one .
A M_part of the L_myth just did n't M_work after that . ’
At their M_peak in the mid-60s , there were 39 L_western L_series on the three L_American L_TV L_networks — L_almost two a L_day on each M_channel .
In the L_US L_weekly L_audience L_ratings in 1965 , there were three L_westerns in the M_top five , and seven in the M_top 10 .
By the mid-80s they had all M_gone the M_way of the L_buffalo : M_extinct L_save for M_preservation in the M_national M_park of L_permanent L_re-runs .

L_Gene L_Autry , the L_first L_TV L_cowboy , now 82 , L_says L_westerns M_dominated the L_early L_days of L_TV L_partly because they had L_lively , L_cheaply L_produced L_visuals , but L_mainly because L_early L_TV was M_starved of L_feature L_films by the L_studios .
L_Westerns were a M_handy M_substitute .
There are L_encouraging M_signs , L_however , that the L_TV L_western is M_struggling M_back into the M_saddle .
L_Paradise , M_launched on L_CBS L_last L_season and M_shown on BBC1 this L_summer , was the L_first L_new L_western L_serial for a L_decade .
It was the only L_new L_drama L_series in L_US L_network L_TV to be M_allowed a L_second L_series this L_year , despite a L_relatively M_lowly 49th L_ranking in the L_ratings .
Its L_creator and L_executive L_producer is , L_perhaps L_surprisingly , L_David L_Jacobs .
Why did he M_follow J R L_Ewing , the L_epitome of 1980s L_TV , with a L_western about a L_gunfighter L_turned L_foster L_father ?
‘ I L_believed the L_genre was L_still an L_important and M_powerful one .
It 's L_something I 've L_always had an L_affection for .

I M_found it was L_possible with L_Paradise to M_talk about L_individual and L_personal L_responsibility , L_something which if M_set in a L_contemporary M_context would have had a L_preachy M_feel about it . ’

L_Lonesome L_Dove , a L_five-part L_story of a L_Texas-to-Montana L_cattle L_drive , L_also L_shown on L_CBS L_last L_year , was the L_best-watched L_TV L_mini-series of any L_kind in L_America for five L_years .
It M_won M_substantial L_critical L_acclaim and will L_show in L_Britain M_next L_year .
The 1989-90 L_season , which L_started this L_month , M_brought another L_new L_prime-time L_western L_series , L_ABC 's L_Young L_Riders , which M_tells the L_story of the L_Pony L_Express .
It L_also M_says a L_lot about L_modern L_American L_TV .

Because the L_networks M_believe L_westerns M_appeal L_mainly to L_middle-aged L_men , L_Young L_Riders has a M_cast of five L_pouting L_young L_male L_actors , in an L_attempt to M_make a L_western with ‘ L_good L_demographics ’ .
The L_effect is L_rather like an M_extended M_advertisement for Marlboro M_Lights .
L_Westerns are no L_longer a L_cheap L_option .
The L_classic L_western L_TV L_series were L_filmed in L_back-lots , or in the L_semi-desert 20 L_miles from L_Los L_Angeles .

L_Modern L_audiences no L_longer L_accept L_plastic L_bushes , and the L_southern L_Californian L_suburban M_sprawl L_means the L_production L_companies have to M_take their L_horses and L_cows to L_locations L_far L_away in L_Arizona or L_Montana .
L_David L_Jacobs L_also M_points out that the L_cost of L_hiring a L_stage-coach is now L_prohibitive .
‘ At one L_time there were L_dozens of L_companies which L_specialised in L_renting out L_western L_paraphernalia .
Now there are L_maybe two .
The L_cost has M_gone through the M_barn M_roof . ’
And L_actors can no L_longer L_ride .
They have to be L_sent to ‘ L_cowboy L_school ’ .
L_Westerns , by their M_nature , M_demand more L_time on L_location .

As a L_result , L_Mr L_Jacobs L_says , it L_cost L_nearly as L_much to M_make an L_episode of L_Paradise , with L_relatively L_unknown L_actors , as an L_episode of L_Dallas , with its M_big M_stars .
Will the L_western M_ride again ?
L_John L_Mantley is L_cautious .
‘ L_Westerns have a M_gladiatorial , L_timeless L_quality .
On the other M_hand you have a M_whole M_generation of L_TV L_watchers that does n't L_really L_know the M_rules .
A L_western is like a L_Japanese L_Noh L_play .
It is a L_stylised L_drama with L_understated L_dialogue that L_depends on L_recognition of L_key L_words and L_concepts .
L_Many of the L_young L_people L_today have n't the L_first L_idea of what 's M_going on . ’
In the M_inert 1950s the L_western L_represented a M_troubled , M_adventurous L_American L_past .

In the M_anxious and L_eventful L_late 1980s and 1990s , they may M_come to L_represent , like All L_Creatures L_Great and L_Small in L_Britain , a L_less L_confusing L_past with L_simpler , M_deeper M_values .
L_Maybe .

On the other M_hand The L_Young L_Riders M_came 51st in the L_ratings in its L_first L_week , M_trailing M_far , M_far behind all the L_modern L_myths about L_modern L_times such as The L_Cosby L_Show , L_Roseanne , L_Golden L_Girls , L_Cheers and L_Matlock .
It is M_premature , then , to L_say that the L_western has M_galloped M_back to M_centre L_screen .
But there is a M_puff of M_dust on the M_horizon .

L_Motoring : A L_lead-free M_lover 's M_guide to L_used L_cars : L_Drivers with a M_tight L_budget and an L_environmental L_conscience can L_buy L_second-hand without M_losing L_principles , L_says L_James L_Ruppert
By L_JAMES L_RUPPERT

FROM this L_month , all L_new L_cars L_submitted for L_British L_type L_approval , the L_test which M_allows them to be L_legally L_sold in the L_UK , must be M_able to M_run on L_lead-free L_petrol .
As a L_result of this M_rule , and L_many L_carefully M_orchestrated L_publicity M_campaigns , the L_motor L_industry 's M_image has now L_changed from L_polluter to M_pal of the L_earth .

But if you have a M_tight L_budget and a L_conscience , L_running L_older L_cars on L_lead-free L_fuel L_becomes a L_much more M_complicated L_issue .
Without the L_presence of a L_lead L_compound , an L_engine 's L_valve M_seats L_go M_unprotected .

The only L_effective M_remedy is to L_install L_hardened L_valve M_seats or a L_replacement L_cylinder M_head , both L_expensive L_options .

L_Less L_costly , but not L_entirely L_satisfactory , is the L_practice of M_making every L_fourth L_tankful L_leaded L_petrol , which L_protects the L_valve M_seats but L_rather M_defeats the M_object .
L_Alternatively there are L_several L_chemical L_additives on the M_market which M_aim to L_provide a L_substitute for L_lead , although the L_case for these L_products has L_yet to be L_proved .

L_However , L_many L_cars L_built within the L_last few L_years have L_hardened L_valve M_seats , or L_alloy L_cylinder M_heads that M_need L_little ( L_simply a M_retune ) or no L_modification to L_use L_unleaded L_petrol .
L_Finding out which L_cars can and which can not is not L_difficult .

L_Esso L_filling L_stations have a M_free L_booklet M_listing most L_models L_produced since 1980 , as does the L_charity L_Clear ( 01-387 4970 ) , with more L_detail L_available in the L_Unleaded L_Petrol L_Guide ( L_Autodale , £2.99 ) .
L_Looking at those L_lists L_provides L_interesting L_reading and L_bears out the L_used-car L_trade 's M_view that having a L_lead-only L_car could L_prove to be a L_liability .
It is not as if L_four-star L_leaded L_fuel is L_going to be L_phased out L_tomorrow , but more and more L_buyers are L_asking : ‘ Does it M_take L_unleaded ? ’
What is L_certain is that the pre-1989 Austin/MG M_range , all L_Skodas , L_Yugos and L_quite a few L_Lancias do not , which does not M_help L_already M_depressed L_resale L_prices .
A 1985 L_Lancia Y10 ( L_lead only ) L_sells for around £2,000 whereas the L_similar L_Fiat L_Uno 55 from the same L_year , M_converted to M_run on L_unleaded , is L_worth around £500 more .
A L_lead-only L_second-hand L_car is now L_worth about 10 per L_cent L_less than an L_unleaded L_equivalent .

L_Even so , L_exotica such as L_lead-only L_Porsche 911s and L_Ferraris are L_unlikely to be M_part of this L_trend , so no L_bargains there I 'm L_afraid .
More L_impressive are the L_Japanese L_manufacturers whose L_cars L_dating from the L_early L_Eighties can M_run on L_unleaded without L_adjustment .
L_Find a 1980 L_Toyota L_Corolla or 1982 L_Nissan L_Sunny that has not M_succumbed to L_rust , and you can L_buy with L_confidence .
On the L_home M_front , most L_Fords and L_Vauxhalls from at L_least the L_mid-Eighties can L_use L_unleaded .
If the ‘ M_greenness ’ of L_going L_unleaded L_still L_seems a M_bit of a M_grey M_area , it is L_possible to L_switch to L_diesel without a M_shadow of L_environmental L_doubt .
L_Diesel L_always has been L_lead-free and the only M_adjustments you L_need to M_make are L_mental M_ones , because L_diesel-powered L_cars are no L_longer L_slow , L_smelly or L_noisy .

L_Perhaps the most M_successful L_maker is L_Peugeot , with a L_complete M_range of L_cars from the L_small 205 — around £3,000 for a 90,000-mile 1985 L_car — to the L_legendary 504 L_estate , about £2,000 for a 1982 L_example .

L_Prestige M_comes in the M_shape of a L_Mercedes with the 240D or ‘ L_Stuttgart L_Taxi ’ , M_commanding £7,000 but M_returning L_unfailing L_reliability .

L_Even if L_lead M_levels in the L_atmosphere do not L_bother you , I am L_sure you will M_find the L_fact that L_unleaded L_petrol is 15p L_cheaper , and that L_diesel L_fuel M_boosts L_mpg by at L_least a L_third , most L_interesting .

L_Drink : L_Desire in M_search of a L_name : Do the L_French have the ‘ L_mot L_juste ’ to L_describe the L_desire for a M_reviving L_drink ?
In the L_first of a L_monthly L_series , L_Michael L_Jackson M_hunts in L_vain
By L_MICHAEL L_JACKSON
L_THANK L_God it 's L_Saturday .

I L_know that L_today is L_Saturday because L_already I am L_thirsty for a M_dry , L_hoppy L_pint of L_bitter at the M_end of the L_afternoon : an L_aperitif to M_sharpen my L_appetite for this L_evening 's L_Indian L_meal .
How did you M_feel as you M_came to the M_end of your L_working L_week L_yesterday L_afternoon ?
L_Boy , I had a L_thirst .

We L_say we are L_thirsty when we L_mean that we L_fancy a L_glass of L_wine , a L_pint of L_beer , a L_gin and L_tonic or a M_shot of L_whisky — the L_pleasure of L_naming our M_poison — at the M_end of a M_busy L_day or L_tiresome L_week .

No , not more M_accurate : ‘ L_thirst ’ is not M_accurate at all as a L_description for this L_apparently L_indescribable L_condition .
It is a L_desire L_millions of us L_know and M_share , L_yet for which we have no L_name .
This L_desire that can not M_find its L_name ( though it would M_dare M_speak it , if it could ) is L_pleasurable .

No , not L_amorous : randy — we have a L_word for that .
Any of these L_conditions is L_pleasurable so L_long as there is a L_good L_likelihood of L_satisfaction in L_reasonably M_short M_order .
L_Let M_puritans and L_pessimists L_damn , L_disapprove or M_dismiss these M_appetites ; that is their M_loss .
Those of us who L_enjoy them L_need only a L_name for each L_condition , so that we may L_discuss them in L_expectation and in L_recollection .
M_Come to L_think of it , neither L_hunger nor L_randiness M_hits L_quite the M_spot .
L_Peckishness and L_lust , L_perhaps ?
Or does that L_sound like a M_firm of M_country M_solicitors ?
This is to L_digress .
What of this L_thirst that can be M_satisfied by an M_unquenching L_drink ?
L_Wine is not M_quenching , but no L_less in L_demand for that .
L_Try to M_quench your L_thirst with a M_light , L_fresh L_white and you will L_drink L_enough to M_put you on your M_back .
L_Beer is , L_quite L_rightly , L_Britain 's L_favourite L_Friday L_night L_drink .

The M_nearest to being M_quenching is the ‘ L_white ’ L_beer of L_Berlin .
L_Anything with L_even a M_modest M_smack of L_hops M_dries the L_palate M_ready for the M_next one .
So , of L_course , does L_alcohol itself .
It may for a L_moment L_seem to M_quench but it L_dehydrates , as L_purportedly L_healthy L_abstainers are L_forever L_telling me .
To M_quench is more than to L_refresh although our M_lying , M_lascivious L_eyes M_tell us the two are the same .

Does any L_drink L_look more M_quenching than one of those L_Italian or L_French L_patent L_aperitifs , M_swirling in a L_refractive L_pink or L_russet M_oiliness , M_clothing the L_melting L_ice : a L_Campari , L_Dubonnet , L_Lillet or ( too L_rare in this L_country ) a L_Picon ?
Are they M_quenching ?
No , L_refreshing .

In L_Strasburg , they have been L_known to M_lace L_beer with L_Picon , L_thereby L_ruining both L_drinks ( as L_Queen L_Victoria L_reputedly did with L_claret and L_malt L_whisky ) , but L_still the L_result is not L_especially M_quenching .

L_Perhaps a L_shimmering M_dry L_Martini L_cocktail ( L_minimum L_dilution , L_stirred , not L_shaken ; and L_served M_straight up ) L_looks L_even more L_refreshing , though its L_effect is that of a M_silver M_mallet .
In the L_right L_place ( L_possibly L_New L_York , but L_San L_Francisco is L_better ) , the L_Martini is the L_ultimate ‘ L_Thank L_God it 's L_Friday ’ L_drink .
The L_requirement for such L_pleasures is a L_matter of L_time and L_place , and it does not have to be L_Friday , L_Berlin or L_Strasburg , L_New L_York or L_San L_Francisco .
Not L_feeling L_thirsty , but L_fancying a L_drink , has a M_world of L_moments .
Some L_Frenchmen L_start the L_day with a L_coffee and L_calvados .
The L_people of L_Munich L_call their L_version of L_Weissbier ‘ L_breakfast L_beer ’ and have it with a L_pair of L_coddled L_veal L_sausages .
L_New L_Orleans M_favours a L_mid-morning L_milk M_punch , or its own L_variation on the L_gin L_fizz .
If the L_moment is before a L_lunch on the L_plane , it L_really ought to be a L_Bloody L_Mary .
If it is at an L_elegant L_dinner L_table , there is a L_choice between a L_fino L_sherry ( or a L_manzanilla ) or L_champagne .
L_None of these L_requires L_anything L_even M_approaching a L_thirst .
Do we L_really ‘ M_wash down ’ a L_good L_meal with L_claret ?
L_Port is L_immediately M_suggested by L_Stilton ; L_cognac by L_coffee .
I do not L_fully L_appreciate the L_experience of an L_American L_late-night L_movie without a L_bourbon , or a L_book at L_bedtime without a L_single L_malt .
These are not L_moments of L_thirst … but nor are they L_causes of L_drunkenness ( unless L_one L_tries to M_pack all such L_experiences into one L_day ) .
We do not L_drink because we are L_thirsty .
Nor , if we are in L_civilised M_cast of L_mind , because we L_wish to L_become L_drunk .
A L_friend of L_mine L_says that her L_body M_tells her , without being M_asked , the L_season of the L_year .
At the M_end of L_summer , her L_body L_stops M_wanting L_gin and L_tonics and L_suddenly M_desires L_whisky .
If it were only a L_matter of L_alcohol , would a L_body M_care ?
L_People will L_nevertheless L_say that the L_desire is for L_nothing more than L_alcohol .
So why not a L_pill or an L_injection ?
Because there would be no L_colour , no M_ritual , no L_time and L_place , no L_glorious L_variety .
L_Worst of all , there would be no L_aroma , L_taste , L_texture or L_finish .
These are L_sensuous L_pleasures at their most L_enjoyable when we M_ritualise them , but how do we M_feel when we L_desire them ?
We , who have so L_many L_words in our L_language , have L_none for this .
But then , do the L_French , L_Spanish or L_Italians have a L_word for it ?
L_Perhaps they do ; L_maybe I have not being M_paying L_attention ; too L_busy with the L_eau-de-vie , L_anis or L_grappa .
Do the L_Greeks have a L_word for it ?
Could we M_borrow , L_beg or L_invent one ?
L_Answers in a L_bottle , L_please .
If you are M_feeling — for L_lack of a L_better L_word -thirsty , L_let's M_meet again M_next L_month .
Same M_time , same M_place ?
It will be my M_turn to L_get them in , I L_think .
In the L_Garden : M_Planning to M_beat a L_leafy M_retreat at L_home : In the L_first of a L_series for M_novice L_gardeners , L_Anna L_Pavord M_stresses the M_value of L_careful L_forethought
By L_ANNA L_PAVORD
L_PLANTS should M_come a M_long M_way down the M_list of L_priorities for the M_novice L_gardener .
There are L_many M_things to L_think about before L_even the L_first L_tentative L_daffodil L_bulb is M_sunk into the L_ground .
The L_first and most L_important L_question to L_mull over as you L_gaze at your L_patch is : What is this L_garden for ?

If you L_start L_writing down some of the L_responses to that L_question , you will M_find you have along the M_way L_acquired a M_ragbag of M_elements that will have an L_important M_bearing on the L_design .
If there are L_small L_children in the M_equation , there will L_need to be a L_flat , L_soft L_area where they can L_fall off L_swings and L_climbing L_frames .

If you L_like L_hanging out L_washing L_rather than L_drying it in the M_bowels of an L_expensive L_machine , you will L_need to L_tuck L_away a L_line and L_make a L_dry L_path to L_get to and from it .

Some M_novice L_gardeners may not L_want to do L_much L_actual L_gardening at all , but L_conversely , do not L_want to L_look out every L_day over a L_scene of M_threadbare L_grass and L_rotting L_fence .
Their L_ideal L_garden will L_look L_good and M_demand L_little L_attention .
If you are a L_dedicated L_sun-worshipper , you L_need to M_mark out the L_part of the L_garden where the L_sun M_lingers L_longest .
It may not be the L_part nearest the L_house , though this is where L_sitting out L_areas L_always L_tend to be L_made .
You may , L_even as a M_novice , L_care so L_passionately about L_plants that all you L_want is the L_maximum L_space to L_grow them in .
L_Raised M_beds L_built down an L_unpromising L_alley could L_provide L_extra L_gardening L_space .
L_Privacy is an L_important L_consideration .
A L_first L_time L_garden is L_usually L_small and L_certainly the L_typical one I am L_imagining for this L_series is no more than 40ft x 20ft and L_surrounded on all L_sides by other L_houses .
L_Privacy is a M_ticklish L_business where M_close L_neighbours are L_concerned .
To L_throw up an L_impenetrable M_Berlin M_Wall between you and them could be L_tactless .
L_Trellis is a L_useful L_compromise and you can L_always L_pretend it was M_forced on you by the L_speed of L_growth of your M_climbing L_rose .

L_Aesthetes among the M_novices will by now be L_thoroughly L_irritable and L_complaining that L_gardens should have as L_much to do with the L_soul as with the L_necessity or not of a L_washing L_line or a L_barbecue L_pit .
So they should , and when the L_list of L_necessities is L_securely L_written down , you can L_ask the L_second L_question : How do I L_want this L_garden to M_feel ?
This L_question M_produces as L_varied a L_response as the L_first .

Some L_urban L_gardeners , as M_short of L_space L_inside as they are out , L_want their L_gardens to be L_extensions of their L_homes , with a M_great M_deal of L_hard L_paving , L_good L_furniture and L_lighting .

L_Closet L_countrysiders may L_want to L_pretend their L_patch is L_actually a L_corner of some L_Sussex L_meadow and M_picture it M_swagged with L_honeysuckle and M_waving with M_ox-eye L_daisies and L_scabious .
This is a L_difficult L_trick to L_bring off with L_suburban L_trains L_hurtling by on one L_side and L_lorries M_grinding through their L_gears on the other .

A L_leafy M_retreat is an L_excellent M_goal for a L_small L_town L_garden , but it is L_best L_made L_acknowledging the L_urban L_setting , L_using L_un-wild L_plants such as L_bamboo , L_acanthus , L_fig , L_vine , L_alchemilla , L_euphorbia , L_wisteria .
While you are L_working through this L_process , M_take M_note of the L_features in the L_garden that you would L_like to L_keep .

In an M_old L_garden , there may be a L_fruit L_tree , or a L_good L_bulwark of L_evergreen L_laurel or L_box that , L_tidied up , could M_add a L_dash of M_venerability to the L_new L_garden that will M_emerge around it .
If you do not L_know what a L_tree or L_shrub is , M_exercise L_clemency and M_give it a L_year 's L_grace to L_demonstrate its M_worth before you M_turn it over to the L_axeman .
The M_mood of the L_garden will M_dictate its L_eventual L_style .

It may be L_clipped L_classical , L_random L_cottage , L_modern L_high-tech , or some L_intensely L_personal M_vision of L_Byzantium , that no L_one has L_ever L_imagined before , but which L_exists in your L_head and M_wants to M_get out .
Do not L_let L_anybody , L_particularly L_gardening L_writers , M_tread on your M_dreams .
All this L_thinking and L_doodling will have done L_nothing L_physically to L_change the L_view outside the L_window , but it is a M_vital M_part of the L_gardening L_process .
Before you can L_make , you have to L_know what it is you are L_making .
L_Property : L_Houses that are M_going , M_going , M_gone : L_Fed up with L_trying to L_sell , more L_people are L_auctioning their L_home L_instead .
L_Andrew L_Bibby L_reports
By L_ANDREW L_BIBBY
IN THE L_small L_Devon L_town of L_South L_Molton , L_Julie L_Widlake is L_waiting with L_anticipation for L_Friday 20 L_October .

L_First , they have to L_sell their L_present L_house , a L_two-bedroom L_cottage in the L_centre of the L_town .
As is the L_case L_almost L_everywhere L_else , the M_market in L_Devon is M_depressed and L_selling has not been L_easy .
So L_instead of L_waiting L_indefinitely for a L_buyer , they have L_decided to L_try L_selling their L_house by L_auction .
It M_comes under the M_hammer at 2.15pm on the 20th , at the L_Barnstaple L_Motel .
‘ We L_accept that we might not L_get very L_much for it , but on the other M_hand we could L_get more , ’ L_says L_Julie L_Widlake .
‘ We 've been L_waiting to L_move for a M_long L_time , and we L_need the L_money to L_build the L_new L_house . ’

Their L_South L_Molton L_cottage ( M_guide L_price £44,000-£46,000 ) is one of more than 20 L_lots to be M_put up for L_sale at the L_Barnstaple L_auction by L_Bristol and L_West L_Property L_Services , and one of more than a hundred which the L_building L_society L_subsidiary will be L_auctioning in eight L_West L_Country L_venues over a L_three-day L_period .

L_Bristol and L_West M_claims these L_auctions will M_help to M_bring some M_action to an L_otherwise M_slow M_market , and M_says it was M_overwhelmed by the M_response from L_people L_wanting to L_sell in this M_way .
L_Auctions L_certainly L_speed up the L_house-buying L_process .
Once the M_hammer has M_fallen , the L_successful L_bidder for a L_house must L_exchange L_contracts L_immediately and L_pay a L_deposit .
L_Completion L_normally M_takes M_place four to eight L_weeks L_later and there is no L_opportunity for L_second L_thoughts .
As the L_Bristol and L_West M_explains , if a L_bidder does not L_sign the L_contract , the L_auctioneer can L_sign on their L_behalf .

‘ From the L_vendor 's M_point of M_view , the L_house is L_actually L_sold once a L_successful L_bid is M_made , ’ L_says L_Graham L_Harrison , L_director of L_Bristol and L_West L_Property L_Services .
‘ L_Many L_people have L_suffered from L_sales L_falling through and from L_house-buying M_chains , and some of our L_vendors M_feel that now 's as L_good a L_time as any to L_sell . ’
From the L_purchasers ' M_point of M_view , L_auctions can L_also be M_attractive — if L_slightly L_nerve-racking as you L_wait for L_bidding to L_start for the L_house of your M_dreams .

The L_problem is that L_normally L_potential L_purchasers have to L_incur the L_expense of L_undertaking M_surveys and M_arranging L_mortgage L_finance , without any L_idea whether they will be L_able to L_afford the L_final L_selling L_price .
Not L_surprisingly , L_several L_estate L_agents L_report L_difficulties at the L_moment in M_attracting L_enough L_serious L_bidders .

‘ With an L_auction , you 've L_got to be L_certain that at L_least two L_buyers are there who can M_commit themselves , and the L_difficulty is that L_buyers who can M_proceed are few and M_far between , ’ L_said L_David L_Phillip , a L_director of L_Yorkshire L_estate L_agents L_Dacre L_Son and L_Hartley .
L_Bristol and L_West M_hopes that by M_arranging L_collective L_auctions it will be M_able to L_overcome this L_problem .

It is L_also L_guaranteeing L_mortgages at 1 per L_cent below the L_normal L_interest L_rate , for L_endowment or M_pension-linked L_policies , on L_several of the L_houses up for L_sale , an L_interesting and L_innovative L_service for L_would-be L_bidders ( L_mortgage M_surveys will L_already have been L_undertaken for these L_houses ) .

The L_building L_society will be M_staffing a L_mortgage L_desk at each L_auction , and M_says L_buyers could M_arrange L_finance there and then , L_subject of L_course to L_proof of L_income and L_status .

L_Obviously , L_however , L_Bristol and L_West M_hopes to L_hear from L_interested L_people in M_advance — if only so it can M_gauge the L_likely L_demand for each L_property before the L_auction L_starts .

‘ We 're L_trying to M_smooth the M_path for L_purchasers , and M_streamline the M_system , ’ L_says L_Graham L_Harrison , M_pointing out that M_live L_telephone L_bidding will L_also be L_available for those L_unable to L_attend .
L_Holiday L_homes and L_commercial L_property have been M_included among the L_lots to be L_auctioned .

Although L_collective L_property L_auctions M_take M_place L_regularly in L_London ( L_often L_primarily for L_investors L_rather than M_house-hunters ) , in L_country L_areas the more L_typical L_auction will be just for one L_house , and as L_likely as not will M_take M_place in a L_nearby L_pub or L_village L_hall .
In L_fact , L_country L_auctions are L_often the M_nearest L_many L_villages M_get to M_live M_theatre .
‘ The L_locals L_come for the L_entertainment , and to L_see who 's L_buying into their L_village , ’ L_observed one L_auction-goer .
L_Pub L_landlords are L_usually only too L_happy to L_provide M_free L_accommodation .
‘ It 's very L_exciting and M_gets the L_adrenalin M_going , ’ L_says L_David L_Phillip , whose L_firm L_usually M_undertakes L_auctions in the L_Otley L_area .
Only L_certain L_types of L_property L_normally M_come to L_auction , L_however .

L_Traditionally , L_country L_cottages and L_houses which have L_unusual or L_unique M_features or are in L_need of a M_lot of L_renovation may be L_auctioned , if only because L_valuation is L_likely to be L_difficult .

L_Sometimes , too , L_houses have to be L_sold by L_auction to L_satisfy the L_legal L_requirements of L_trustees or L_executors ( L_auctions L_provide L_adequate L_proof that the L_property has been L_sold at the L_going M_market L_value , and M_protect L_trustees from L_future L_claims of L_negligence ) .
L_Less L_happily , but for the same L_reason , L_repossessed L_houses are L_often L_auctioned .
L_Anyone M_considering L_selling by L_auction L_needs to be L_aware that the L_costs L_involved will be M_higher .
L_Advertising L_costs and any L_expenses L_incurred in L_hiring L_premises are L_normally M_passed on by the L_estate L_agents to the L_vendor , whether or not the L_auction L_results in a L_sale .
In L_addition , L_agents may M_charge L_slightly more L_commission than L_usual for a M_successful L_sale .

In L_Bristol and L_West 's L_forthcoming L_auctions , a L_set L_fee of £375 plus L_VAT will be M_charged to L_everyone M_entering L_property to L_sell , with its L_usual L_agent 's M_commission ( about 2 per L_cent plus L_VAT ) M_charged on M_top when L_sales are M_made .
‘ We L_accept that we could M_lose the L_money we 've L_paid to M_go to L_auction , but that 's a L_risk we 're M_prepared to M_take , ’ L_says L_Julie L_Widlake .
The L_secret of a L_successful L_outcome L_depends L_partly on M_setting the L_right L_reserve L_price , a L_task the L_auctioneer L_undertakes in L_conjunction with the L_seller .
L_Normally , the L_reserve is M_set only L_days or L_hours before the L_auction , when the L_agents will L_already have a L_good L_indication of how L_much L_interest has been M_shown .

L_Inevitably they do not L_always M_get it L_right .

L_Peter L_Crowther , L_managing L_director of a L_Leeds L_business M_centre , L_recently L_bought two L_semi-detached L_stone L_cottages in L_Bramhope , on the L_outskirts of L_Leeds , at an L_auction in the L_village L_pub .

On the other M_hand , L_sometimes the M_drama of the L_auction and the L_competition between L_bidders can have the M_opposite L_effect .
Another L_recent L_auction in L_Leeds M_saw a L_run-down L_stone L_farmhouse without L_water or other L_amenities L_finally M_fall under the M_hammer for £330,500 .
‘ L_Success is by no L_means L_guaranteed at L_auction , ’ L_says L_Graham L_Harrison .
‘ In a M_tough M_market you L_need to M_get the L_programme L_right , the L_price L_right and have a L_little M_bit of L_luck . ’
L_Bristol and L_West L_Property L_Services ( 0272 294271 ) has L_produced a L_brochure M_covering all eight L_West L_Country L_auctions .

By L_ANGELA L_LAMBERT
UNTIL six or seven L_years L_ago , L_outsiders M_associated L_East L_Anglia with L_fens , L_flatness and the L_vanished L_Edwardian L_nannies of L_Frinton .

L_Lavenham and L_Long L_Melford , for L_example , have no L_telegraph L_poles , to M_preserve the L_timeless M_air that M_pervades them .

In L_Kahlo 's L_work there is a M_powerful M_mix of these L_discourses , L_yet her M_role as an L_archetypal L_woman L_painter has M_come to M_dominate L_responses to her L_work .

IF a L_dwelling L_house is in such a L_state of L_disrepair as to be L_prejudicial to L_health or a L_nuisance , the L_tenant may M_lay an L_information against his L_landlord L_alleging the L_existence of a L_statutory L_nuisance under the L_Public L_Health L_Act 1936 .

The L_facts .
L_Mrs L_Bujok and her L_family L_occupied a L_house as L_council L_tenants .

The L_council M_appealed by L_case L_stated .

M_Section 92(1) of the 1936 L_Act M_defines ‘ L_statutory L_nuisances ’ as ‘ any L_premises in such a L_state as to be L_prejudicial to L_health or a L_nuisance ’ .

L_Prototyping is L_crucial to L_systems L_development , L_argues L_Ian L_Richards M_Tailored to M_fit .
IN L_SYSTEMS L_development L_nothing is more L_fundamental than M_assessing L_user L_requirements .
If you do n't L_know what the L_system is L_required to do ; you do n't L_know L_anything .
But L_many L_system L_developers are L_unable to M_assess L_requirements L_properly .
They L_seem to L_think that you can L_ask a L_businessman what his L_requirements are and M_get an L_answer that M_amounts to a L_draft L_system L_specification .
A M_doctor does n't M_ask his M_patient what M_treatment to M_prescribe .
The M_patient can M_explain only what the M_problem is .
It is the M_doctor that M_provides the M_remedy .
If you L_ask a L_user what L_sort of L_system he L_wants you will be M_met with a M_blank L_look .
A L_user may have a M_deep L_knowledge of L_business L_problems , but L_knowing L_little about L_computers , has no L_idea how they should be M_tackled .
L_Yet , L_analysts are L_heard L_asking L_time and again , ‘ L_Tell me what you L_want .
We 've M_gone awayfrom the L_days of L_systems M_imposed by the L_data L_processing L_department , this is L_going to be a L_system for the L_users . ’
But of L_course the L_users do n't L_know what they L_want , so they L_end up L_getting another L_duff L_system .
An L_effective L_analyst L_provides the same M_service to the L_business as the M_doctor M_provides to the M_patient .
He L_finds out what the M_needs of the L_business are , and M_prescribes the M_cure .
The L_user L_tells the L_analyst what the L_problems are , and the L_analyst L_decides , at L_least in M_broad M_terms , what the L_user L_requires .
But the L_analyst has one M_great L_advantage over the L_doctor .
Once the L_user L_becomes M_familiar with the L_proposed L_system , M_helpful L_comments M_come M_thick and M_fast .
‘ Oh , this will be of M_great L_help in L_ordering M_raw L_materials , but L_sometimes we L_get L_part L_deliveries , could we have an L_extra M_facility to M_deal with those ?
And L_sometimes L_non-standard L_discount is M_given , a M_pig to M_deal with on the L_old L_system , but if you could L_add one L_extra M_input M_box on that L_screen there …
And what about L_orders not L_delivered on L_time ?
If we could L_list those we 'd have L_advance L_warning of L_shortage L_problems on the L_assembly L_lines two L_months before they L_occur .
Now that would be a M_great M_leap M_forward . ’
L_Unfortunately you can not M_reach this M_stage until you have L_developed a L_prototype L_system .
And you ca n't L_develop a L_prototype L_system because the L_users have n't M_got a M_clue what they L_want .
Most of them are L_probably L_muttering , ‘ I 'm too L_busy to L_get L_involved in this L_sort of M_thing .
What 's L_wrong with the L_old L_system L_anyway ? ’
The only M_way to L_develop a L_prototype is for the L_analyst to M_get inside the L_head of the L_user and , L_thinking like a L_user , L_decide what L_sort of L_system is L_required .
Of L_course , the L_initial L_system will not be L_perfect .
The L_analyst can not L_hope to L_understand the L_business as L_well in a few L_weeks as the L_user does after L_many L_years .
But once the L_user M_sees the L_system , M_channels of L_communication will M_open .
L_Instead of L_persuading the L_user to L_specify L_requirements , the L_analyst will be M_driven by the L_user to M_meet L_key L_needs .
L_Good L_system L_development M_goes through two M_distinct M_phases .
L_Initially the L_analyst does all the L_work , M_leading the L_user towards a L_system he L_thinks is L_right for the L_business .
But once the L_user M_sees the L_potential of the L_system , a M_change in M_attitude M_takes M_place .
The L_process L_becomes L_demand L_driven by the L_user .
The L_analyst is then M_forced on the M_defensive , L_explaining why M_new M_features can not be L_included because they are L_technically L_difficult or M_prohibitively L_expensive .
L_Traditionally , L_systems were L_validated by L_users L_agreeing L_functional L_specifications .
In L_theory , L_validation M_meant that the L_user had L_read the L_specification , L_imagined how the L_system would M_work in L_practice , and L_agreed the M_design .

It was only when L_using a ‘ L_test ’ L_version of the L_system ( L_available just before the M_planned L_implementation L_date ) that L_difficulties would M_come to M_light , and a L_host of M_change L_requests be L_issued .
The L_advent of L_fourth M_generation M_languages ( 4GLs ) has M_made L_system L_development L_much L_easier .
With a 4GL an L_initial L_prototype can be M_put M_together L_quickly .
This M_means M_feedback is L_obtained L_early in the L_development L_process , and the L_system can M_grow around the L_user 's L_requirements .
L_Crucial to the L_development L_process is the L_relationship M_built up between the L_analyst and the L_user .
The L_best L_systems M_arise when both have a M_deep L_understanding of each other 's L_jobs .
L_Many L_developers M_use L_business L_analysts to L_ensure that the L_development M_team M_maintain a L_proper M_focus on L_business L_requirements .
But this can be L_counter-productive , as it M_cuts off L_communication between the L_systems L_analyst and the L_user .

Too L_much L_specialisation is L_bad for L_systems L_development ; it M_feeds the L_temptation to L_get L_engrossed in L_technical L_difficulties and L_forget about the M_underlying L_business L_needs .

If you should L_stroll into a L_pub and L_meet an L_analyst and a L_user L_talking about L_work , and you can not M_tell one from the other , they have L_probably L_developed a M_successful L_system M_together .
L_Ian L_Richards ' L_book , How to L_Use a L_Computer to L_Improve Your L_Business , has just been L_published by L_Graham & L_Trotman ( £8.95 L_paperback ; £16 L_hardback ) .
